speaker: Rodrigue
text: Even though it's in ruins, in some strange way, this monastery never truly changes, does it? I studied at the Officers Academy when I was young. Those memories come rushing back whenever I return. What are you doing at this hour, anyway?

speaker: Byleth
text: I couldn't sleep.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: It's the same for me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Nothing.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I see.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Perhaps you'll allow me to join you...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: . I keep recalling my eldest son... He was quite gifted. In fact, he was appointed a knight at the age of 15. I still vividly remember the day he was granted a sword from His Majesty...

speaker: Byleth
text: Your son... Isn't he...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Dead. He was killed nine years ago in Duscur. All that returned of him that day were his sword and his armor... After it happened, I said something horrible to Felix. He's hated me ever since...and I don't blame him. No matter how much you grieve, the dead will never return. No magic in the world can bring them back. That's why their memory clings to the living like a curse. The more they were loved, the tighter their hold, and the more suffering they cause... I fear I am not a strong enough man to scold His Highness for his foolishness.

speaker: Byleth
text: Someone must.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Right you are... As adults, it is our responsibility to scold him and help him find his way again, but really... I'm just a failure of a man.

speaker: Byleth
text: I know how you feel...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Since this war began, we've seen countless generals, soldiers, and citizens die. It never gets easier.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Professor... I entrust the young prince, and the future of Faerghus, to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: This is unexpected...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I suppose that was a dramatic way of putting it. My apologies.

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't let you down.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You're a brave one, aren't you? One worthy of leading the Church of Seiros, I daresay.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You should know that I have no intention of insisting that you take back Fhirdiad. All I ask is that you continue to rein in Dimitri's manic desire for revenge. Now then... we have received House Riegan's consent. All that's left is for us to depart. If we make it through Gloucester Territory and across the Great Bridge of Myrddin, we'll be in Empire territory. You are not afraid, are you?

speaker: Byleth
text: A little.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Ha! No need to worry. Don't you underestimate the power of my soldiers.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't feel anything.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Yes.Such is war...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm glad you were the one to lead the Blue Lion House, Professor. I mean that...

speaker: Dimitri
text: If you stand in my way, I will strike you down.

speaker: Felix
text: Leaving the house in my uncle's hands? What is the old man thinking? I always knew my father was mad, but this time he's gone too far.

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Felix
text: My uncle is a reliable man. But still.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm actually grateful to him.

speaker: Felix
text: Easy for you to say. You hardly know the man.

speaker: Felix
text: Only a fool would abandon his own territory.

speaker: Ashe
text: The area around Castle Gaspard, where I was living, is under the control of House Rowe, who have submitted to the Empire. If I hadn't come to Garreg Mach, I might have ended up as your enemy at Ailell. That thought makes me really happy to be here now. I don't think I would have been able to handle facing all of you in battle.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I had an encounter with Lord Gwendal... How many years ago was it? Back before the academy, I met this girl who I fell madly in love with...and her dad tried to kill me. I suppose he just tried to scare me, but I was sure I was gonna die. Oh yeah, her dad? Lord Gwendal. Crazy, right? I never thought I'd seriously be trying to kill the guy in battle. I kind of don't know how to make sense of it.

speaker: Mercedes
text: It looks like we're all set with food supplies, thanks to Lord Rodrigue! We have more soldiers to feed now, so we'll still need to ration... But I think we have enough extra to make some tasty treats! I'll go scout the pantry.

speaker: Byleth
text: That would be wonderful.

speaker: Mercedes
text: We can enjoy it together over some tea!

speaker: Byleth
text: We shouldn't be wasteful...

speaker: Mercedes
text: That's true, but it's important to indulge every now and again. It's been so difficult lately and everyone is worn out. We won't be able to go on if we don't treat ourselves!

speaker: Annette
text: Next we face the Great Bridge of Myrddin... We actually crossed it a long time ago. Do you remember? It was five whole years ago!

speaker: Byleth
text: During the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

speaker: Annette
text: It seems like so long ago, doesn't it? It's odd how fast time flies...

speaker: Byleth
text: When we went to Remire Village?

speaker: Annette
text: What are you talking about, Professor? It was on the way to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion!

speaker: Annette
text: Everyone was still friends then. After the fighting, we all ate together without splitting into our separate houses. I often wish we could go back to those peaceful days...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Just like House Fraldarius, House Galatea is currently being invaded by the Dukedom. My family is not as wealthy as most others, so we are incapable of sparing resources or reinforcements. I'm sorry. It's just so frustrating, not being able to do anything to help.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: What used to be Aegir territory lies far to the east of the Great Bridge of Myrddin, downstream of the Airmid River. For the sake of my family, I wish we could invade the Empire from there. But I do not have the power to advocate for that. Strategically, Myrddin is more important.

speaker: Byleth
text: Someday, we'll take it back.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Thank you, Professor. I will not give in. Not until I have restored my noble pride!

speaker: Byleth
text: Taking it back would be difficult.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Yes, I know it would be difficult, but I will not give in!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Since I'm originally from the Empire, it seems no one trusts me with any important tasks. Fine by me. Honestly, I'd bet they're watching my every move to make sure I can be trusted.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure they're not...

speaker: Linhardt
text: If I were in charge, it's what I would do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I knew it. War makes people crazy, huh?

speaker: Caspar
text: The Airmid River separates the Empire and Alliance. It's the largest river in Fódlan. Sometimes it'll flood when there's lots of rain, but... At least the land gets some extra water!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: War isn't kind to you if you're a recluse. By the time you realize what's going on, you're already under attack. And if you're off by yourself, you can get killed with no one ever finding out.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like you're learning.

speaker: Byleth
text: I highly doubt that would happen.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh, that'd be awful--just terrible! OK, Professor, I get it. I know I'll have to come out.

speaker: Dorothea
text: We're going to invade the Empire...which means we'll be fighting people we know, won't we? If we're attacked by someone we know, or used to think of as a friend, is it permitted to run away?

speaker: Byleth
text: No, it's not OK.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Makes sense. A commander running away would be terrible for morale.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wouldn't blame you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Really? If something happens, will you keep me safe?

speaker: Petra
text: If we can suppress this Myrddin, we can invade into the Empire. Right? I was in the Empire. Now I will be an enemy... I am having strange feelings. It is with ease that an ally turns into an enemy.

speaker: Raphael
text: I finally got to eat a full meal for the first time in forever, and it's all thanks to Lord Rodrigue! I've got so much energy! Let me at that Great Bridge of Myrddin! I'll bust it down myself! Oh, but then how do we cross?

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Great Bridge of Myrddin isn't just a bridge. It has the features of a fortress. I believe it was built for military purposes by the first leader of the Adrestian Empire. In other words, it's even older than the monastery. So if we occupy the Great Bridge, we'll have to search it from top to bottom.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm sure you know this already, but House Ordelia is aligned with the Empire. They face the Empire from across a river, similar to the Gloucesters. Even so, I refuse to yield to the Empire a second time. The Empire did unthinkable things to my family. And to me. The only option here is winning. Professor, you must promise we will overcome the Empire.

speaker: Marianne
text: My adoptive father is planning on supporting the Riegan family in the upcoming operation. He says it's the perfect opportunity to get both the Alliance and the Kingdom on his side. He even insisted that I promote the good name of House Edmund to the people of the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: Have you managed to do that?

speaker: Marianne
text: No... I'm not very good at this sort of thing.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you really need to promote them?

speaker: Marianne
text: He'll see right through me if I lie, so I can't ignore the request...

speaker: Marianne
text: But I suppose I did just tell you, so that must count for something.

speaker: Hilda
text: Claude says he's on our side. I know everything will be fine if we leave it to him! He may act like a layabout, but he's actually smart. And although Claude isn't honest about some things, you can trust him when it counts.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're not calming my nerves.

speaker: Hilda
text: No, I'm sure it'll be fine! That's just my gut feeling, but still.

speaker: Byleth
text: Yeah, I'm not worried.

speaker: Hilda
text: Yeah, he'll do us proud! That's just my gut feeling, but still.

speaker: Leonie
text: Lord Rodrigue seems reliable. But even with his help, aren't we still a little shorthanded? We can probably make it to the Great Bridge of Myrddin. But beyond that, I don't know. Don't let Dimitri push you too much, Professor. It'll shorten your life for sure.

speaker: Seteth
text: So, the renowed Shield of Faerghus is now on our side. That is quite reassuring. Not only will he provide valuable support in battle, but he has also brought us much-needed supplies. We cannot grow complacent, however. We must take the Imperial capital as soon as possible.

speaker: Flayn
text: Being here brings back all manner of memories. The days I spent studying here with you and everyone else--those days were so special to me. They truly were some of the warmest days of my life. I hold them dear in my heart. And now, to be forced to fight with those I was once so close to, my friends... It is most saddening.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The battle at Ailell was a tactical marvel. You grow stronger with each passing day. Where does your talent end and your Crest's power begin? Are they one and the same, I wonder? Most intriguing. Yet it is quite difficult to draw useful conclusions, given the situation. It is quite unfortunate I did not achieve my research goals before the war broke out. So much unknown. Now, I fear I will not have those answers even by conflict's end. So very frustrating.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, hello there, Professor. Did you need something from me? It doesn't look like you're wounded or anything. You just looking for...someone to talk to?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Manuela
text: I thought so. Well, I'm here for you! Making you feel better is my top priority.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Manuela
text: Come on now, you don't have to be shy. Helping you feel better is important to me.

speaker: Manuela
text: Whether it's physical pain or worries of the heart, you can come to me for anything, Professor.

speaker: Gilbert
text: House Fraldarius is a military house. They swore fealty to the royal family at the Kingdom's founding. The current family head, Lord Rodrigue, was raised like a brother to the former king. He harbors a loyalty that goes beyond mere duty. Perhaps that is why he was willing to lend us his aid.

speaker: Alois
text: I thought House Fraldarius had an invasion of their own to worry about. I'm impressed Lord Rodrigue was willing to provide us all these reinforcements and supplies. The knights' morale is really boosted, seeing as they have had their first good meal in a while. Let's hope we can keep this up, and take down the Great Bridge of Myrddin!

speaker: Catherine
text: Gwendal made the ultimate sacrifice in service of House Rowe. I understand that feeling. I'd do anything for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: But--

speaker: Catherine
text: You think we should have stopped him. You might be right about that.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand it too.

speaker: Catherine
text: I'm surprised. I didn't peg you as the kind of person to say that sort of thing.

speaker: Catherine
text: At any rate, it's up to the individual how to demonstrate loyalty.

speaker: Shamir
text: So, House Riegan accepted. I knew the leader of the Alliance wouldn't refuse. Still, we can't let our guard down. There's no telling when he'll turn on us. If we advance through the Alliance into the Empire, our chances for reconnaissance will be limited. I just hope it goes according to plan.

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea must be so scared. We gotta find her quick as we can. We got reinforcements from the Kingdom people now, right? Then we oughta be able to go save her!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Even after all these decades, the academy hasn't changed a bit. I remember it well, even now. I used to sneak out of lectures with Lambert almost every day... I suppose this is not the time for an old man's nostalgia. We have received approval from House Riegan. We should set out as soon as you're ready.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Lord Rodrigue is revered by all as the Shield of Faerghus. I was imagining a more stern-faced fellow, but he's actually quite friendly. Shocking! I heard that he recently spent the night drinking in the dining hall with soldiers from the church...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Our scout has returned. As expected, there are quite a few Imperial soldiers stationed there.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see. So the enemy has prepared for our arrival... It matters not. I will kill them all, whether they are one or one hundred.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not necessary.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't say such things...

speaker: Dimitri
text: What would you do, if you saw the people who stole everything from you? If you saw them right before your eyes, living carefree lives and feeling no guilt. Would you feel nothing? Do nothing? Five years ago... Did you not deem the woman who killed Jeralt to be unforgivable? I am most certain that you did. You couldn't let her get away with her crime, so you took up your sword in pursuit.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're wrong.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I think not. We're the same, you and I.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're right.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Precisely my point. We're the same, you and I.

speaker: Felix
text: You're wasting your time. There's nothing to be gained from exchanging words with a boar that has lost its mind.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Felix...

speaker: Felix
text: This is war. Every last one of us has lost someone we care for. But we choose to suppress our anger and go right on living. Do you know why?

speaker: Byleth
text: Because we've given up.

speaker: Felix
text: Revenge can't bring the dead back to life. Unfortunately such a thing isn't possible. Hanging onto your anger, like the boar here, is futile.

speaker: Byleth
text: Because it's pointless.

speaker: Felix
text: That's right. All the boar is accomplishing is stacking up more corpses.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Tell me, Felix... If the dead are beyond reach, is it not also pointless to mourn or even bury those who are lost?

speaker: Felix
text: Ha. That mind of yours. I'm done here. Remember, Professor. It's not compassion for this fool that has brought our army so far. There are those of us who despise the Empire, and those who side with the church. If we keep running down this path, it's only a matter of time before the ground beneath us collapses.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: That's enough, Felix.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. You're a damned fool, old man.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The soldiers are ready to march on your command.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Then let's move out at once. Every moment counts.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Understood. Let's show those Empire dastards the power of the Knights of Faerghus!

speaker: Ladislava
text: That symbol...it's an enemy raid! Stay calm and face them head-on. Send a messenger to Acheron immediately! If we're quick, we might be able to pull off a pincer attack!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard's dog, huh? All the more reason to kill her.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Attack Ladislava and take the bridge. Shall we begin?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Let's deal with the enemies protecting the fortress quickly, and take control of this area.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Enemies approaching! Get the soldiers standing by to join the fight! We may need to hurry up preparations of the ballista too. Protect the fortress!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: You think we'll let you take this bridge form us?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: This is no good... Reinforcements keep coming, and more will soon join them.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness! Apologies for the late arrival.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... You're alive... How?!

speaker: Dedue
text: We can discuss it later. For now, allow me to join your forces.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I, Lorenz Hellman Gloucester, have arrived to join the battle in my father's stead!

speaker: Alliance General
text: We'll ally ourselves with the Imperial soldiers too!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Thanks for making your way here. Annihilate the enemy with the rest of them!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Is that...the professor? Why would someone like that join such a senseless fight?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Lorenz! Here you are. I am heading south, so I will leave this area to you.

speaker: Ladislava
text: Acheron! Now's the time to show your loyalty to the Empire! Attack the enemy from behind!

speaker: Acheron
text: I've got to make her name known to Her Majesty through distinguished service.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Acheron, a minor lord of the Alliance territory... If he's fighting for the Empire, we've no choice but to attack him.

speaker: Acheron
text: As they say, if you can't beat them, join them. I'm not in for a beating, am I?

speaker: Acheron
text: Argh... I never should have allied with... the Empire...

speaker: Ladislava
text: To repay Her Majesty's favor...I will not let you pass!

speaker: Ladislava
text: I can't retreat... Even if it costs me my life, I've got to protect the Great Bridge.

speaker: Ladislava
text: Lady Edelgard... I'm sorry...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ladislava, no! I will protect this area!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: After this battle, I will be known far and wide as the legendary Ferdinand of Adrestia!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Edelgard has always been obsessed with you. I am a little envious, to be frank. I will just have to impress her with my skills on the battlefield!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Oh, Ferdie. You opposed Edie for so long... I had real hopes for you, you know? Now you're following her. Is that your duty as a noble? Follow your master when they say to heel?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I will not try to explain my duty or hers. You would not understand. I wish you could. Anyway, no time for idle chitchat!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Retreat, Ladislava! Tell Her Majesty about this!

speaker: Ladislava
text: We've already sent a messenger! I can't let you die while I flee!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: In that case... Even if I die, you must protect this area.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Even if I die, please... protect this area.

speaker: Lorenz
text: To oppose the Empire at a time like this would be entirely too reckless.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It's been a while, Professor. If this were anywhere but a battlefield, I would offer you tea. I've no choice but to follow the Empire, if I wish to live. I hope you will not think ill of me.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Lay me to rest...in a manner that is befitting...of the nobility...

speaker: Lorenz
text: I yield. Though I will not beg for my life. That would be unbecoming, wouldn't it?

speaker: Lorenz
text: You're inviting me to join you? But...to abandon House Gloucester... No--I can convince my father. I will help you topple the Empire, I swear it!

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's a farce. All of it...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue! Why...How are you here? You died. Five years ago...

speaker: Dedue
text: I was saved by my brothers. Men of Duscur.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Those people you were with... They were of Duscur? And they saved you?

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness. I asked that you fulfill your long-held desire, did I not? Allow me to once again act as your sword and shield. Please, let me witness your triumph. I want to behold the moment your wish is finally granted.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... Of course. And in exchange, I ask that you swear something to me, here and now. Do not ever throw your life away again. Understood?

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness... Understood.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Idiots. Embracing death for the sake of that woman. Truly foolish...

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you happy we won?

speaker: Byleth
text: What troubles you?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I... I don't know.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you regret killing them?

speaker: Dimitri
text: They were just beasts with human faces. I had no choice but to kill them, and so I did. That...that is all there is to it.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: It's about time you two returned. We must discuss our next course of action.

speaker: Maiden
text: Please! I need to join you, no matter the cost!

speaker: Kingdom General
text: I'm sorry, but my hands are tied...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: By the goddess! What's with all the commotion?

speaker: Maiden
text: *gasps*

speaker: Rodrigue
text: What is this girl doing here? This is an army, not an orphanage.

speaker: Kingdom General
text: I believe she's from a nearby village. She keeps insisting that she needs to join our ranks.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: And you thought we could use a child on the front lines? Hurry up and take her back to her parents.

speaker: Maiden
text: My family is gone. I don't have anywhere else to go. Please! I can use magic and I can fight! I can cook, do laundry, anything!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm sure there are plenty of more suitable places to find work. Why are you so fixated on this army, young lady?

speaker: Maiden
text: I need...to get revenge. I must strike down the one who murdered my big brother!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness... What should we do?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Let her do as she pleases.

speaker: Maiden
text: Thank you...very much.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ah, there you are. His Highness was looking for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where is he?

speaker: Gilbert
text: He's gone ahead, and started interrogating the prisoner–Viscount Kleiman's man. He said he'd like for you and I to be present as well. Will you come with me?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I cannot overlook your reckless remarks. Are you really so keen to lose your head?

speaker: Prisoner
text: I only did what I believed was right. I swear to the goddess that I'm not lying. Amidst the turmoil of the tragedy, Lady Patricia was supposed to be the only one who was unharmed. We had been given orders ahead of time to not approach her carriage...

speaker: Byleth
text: Was Patricia an accomplice?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course not. What would my stepmother have had to gain from such a...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Perhaps Lady Patricia would have done anything to return to the Empire...to her husband and daughter.

speaker: Dimitri
text: What exactly are you implying?

speaker: Gilbert
text: For the past few months, I've been spying on lords who defected to the Empire in order to investigate rumors about Lady Patricia. Cornelia's words were true. The two of them... I am afraid they conspired together, after all.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Enough of this nonsense. You say she wished to return home? That isn't nearly enough reason to cause such a tragedy.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I do not intend to imply that the two of them were solely responsible for the whole affair. There were likely nobles who opposed the king, or potentially someone who wanted to throw the Kingdom into chaos. The Empire, and people like Solon and Kronya, had their motives, too.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So my stepmother joined with them to cause the tragedy... Is that what you believe?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ultimately, this is just conjecture based on the evidence at hand. I have no idea what their true intentions were.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see. We will hear what this man has to say. For now...

speaker: Prisoner
text: My lord had long felt that King Lambert's radical ways were dangerous. At the time, he was approached with an offer to take part in the incident at Duscur... My lord loves his homeland. To me, he embodied justice. We were only doing what we thought was right.

speaker: Dimitri
text: And so, in the name of justice, he caused massacre upon massacre out of love for his homeland. You murdered your own king, killed our soldiers, and involved innocent citizens. And yet you have the gall to speak of justice?

speaker: Prisoner
text: I am only standing before you now because I could no longer bear the weight of my sins.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you share those feelings about your homeland?

speaker: Prisoner
text: Yes... I believe I do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you regret your actions?

speaker: Prisoner
text: No. I accept your hatred, and even the punishment of death, but I still believe it was a massacre in the name of justice.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Gilbert. Lock this man in his cell.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Are you not...going to kill him?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will make that decision once I have had time to consider this man's definition of justice.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Yes, Your Highness.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No... I cannot say that I am. Tell me, Professor... How well do you remember your father, Jeralt?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not very well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I figured as much. Even the memory of those who pass away is taken from those they left behind. Little by little. Year by year.

speaker: Byleth
text: Very well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Soon enough you will come to understand how painful it is to forget the faces of those who have passed on.

speaker: Dimitri
text: To be honest, I cannot really remember my stepmother's...that woman's smile. Nor the sound of her voice. I always told myself that I would not allow my mind to forget. And yet...all I can recall with clarity is her gazing away, so forlorn. Did my stepmother wish to go home so badly that she would kill Father and me...kill her false family? Home...to her own blood. Her true family.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no way to know for sure.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't have those answers.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I suppose it doesn't make any difference now. I am asking you questions you could not possibly know the answer to. I am finished with thoughts like that. I am finally able to go on living without clinging to hate. If I truly treasure those who have died, then I must earnestly atone for my sins. Father, Glenn, all of the soldiers who have fallen... The people of Duscur who still suffer persecution... The only atonement I can offer them now is to take responsibility for this broken Kingdom that has been entrusted to me.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's true.

speaker: Byleth
text: Take responsibility for the Kingdom...

speaker: Dimitri
text: That is why I feel that I must meet with Edelgard and try to talk to her. Do you think it's a fool's errand? Honestly... I think so too. But I must swallow my feelings and grudges–our whole history, really–and ask her about this future that she sees. What she aims for once her domination is complete. What kind of justice she clings to as she fights. And why she felt it necessary to start this war... I believe that asking her these things is the true responsibility I have been tasked with as king.

speaker: Byleth
text: How will you accomplish this?

speaker: Dimitri
text: We will march our troops to the Imperial capital. But before any battle begins, we will set up camp nearby and send a messenger. I will tell her that I need to speak with her in a safe place, without any weapons or troops. As to whether or not she will agree to my request... Well, that rests solely on Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm certain she'll agree.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I would like to believe that as well. You know, Professor... When we fought in Fhirdiad, Cornelia mocked me and called me pitiful. But even if it is true that my stepmother never loved me, I am not to be pitied. After all, I have allies and dear friends who care for me. And now, I also have you by my side.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Our next battlefield will be the Imperial capital. There will be no turning back. If you have any unfinished business here, you had best settle it before we depart.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's not enough time.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I apologize, but you'll have to make do with the time you have. We cannot afford a delay.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I knew I could count on you. Good luck.

speaker: Dedue
text: I believe in you, but please ensure that his Highness survives as well. Fódlan's future would be in peril if we lost him. I would not be able to go on.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Dedue
text: Thank you,

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand.

speaker: Dedue
text: Good.

speaker: Felix
text: He intends to speak to the emperor? She's his stepsister, I know, but this seems risky.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's important.

speaker: Felix
text: Pah! I know that!

speaker: Byleth
text: You're against it?

speaker: Felix
text: No, I'm not. I'm sure he's thought it through.

speaker: Felix
text: If the two can settle this diplomatically, that would be the best way out of this mess. No more bloodshed. Let's just hope he doesn't become so overwhelmed with emotion that he's unable to strike her down... should the need arise.

speaker: Ashe
text: Returning to the monastery brings back so many memories from five years ago. Hard to believe we only spent a year together here. So much happened that it felt a lot longer than that. But it was so exciting. And so much fun. Honestly, I think those memories are what's kept me fighting this long. What was that year like for you, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: It was a lot of fun.

speaker: Ashe
text: I don't think I could ask for a better answer.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was challenging.

speaker: Ashe
text: Ah...yeah, there were a lot of hard times too.

speaker: Ashe
text: Let's all do our best to survive this, so we can come back here when it's all over. I know that's what I'll be doing.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I've been thinking about how we've got our own ideas about justice...and so does the Empire. And what's coming, it's not just a battle between us and them. It's our ideals that are fighting. Whoever wins will say they were right and the other side was wrong. And I get it. That's how it goes... But nobody's willing to talk or compromise, so we'll fight to the death to prove the other guy's wrong. It won't be an easy battle, but let's make sure we come back alive. Right, Professor?

speaker: Mercedes
text: We'll be heading for the capital soon. So much rests on this moment. Will the war really be over if we take the capital?

speaker: Byleth
text: It might not end right away.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You're probably right...but we'll get there eventually.

speaker: Byleth
text: Definitely.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Yay! I'm sure it won't end right away, but that's still great news!

speaker: Mercedes
text: I truly believe that a peaceful future is waiting at the end of all this.

speaker: Annette
text: I hope this is the final battle. Don't you, Professor? When the war is over, everyone will be busy with their own lives... But let's all meet up again someday. Right here at Garreg Mach. You, His Highness, my father, our monastery friends, the knights...everyone!

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a great idea.

speaker: Annette
text: It was just a silly whim I had, but I really love it!

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if that's possible...

speaker: Annette
text: All that matters is whether we choose to make it happen. I really hope that we do!

speaker: Annette
text: Ooh, and I'll bake a bunch of desserts for it! Reunion sweets! All we have to do now is win! Let's get to it, Professor!

speaker: Ingrid
text: I'm so glad you were assigned to the Blue Lion House, Professor. We made it this far thanks to your guidance and leadership. There's a bitter fight ahead - that much is certain. You have my lance.

speaker: Byleth
text: We're counting on you.

speaker: Byleth
text: We will prevail!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Yes. Let's do this together!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Professor. At last, the end is nigh. I love the Empire. Part of me wants it to survive. But I know that is not reasonable. The Empire's time has come. The Kingdom is battle-scarred, the Alliance is in tatters... People must be terrified. The world is crumbling around them. What we need now is a mighty leader who can rebuild Fódlan and rule it as a single nation. Nonetheless, it saddens me that we will not have an Adrestian emperor...

speaker: Linhardt
text: When you think of it, as one approaches the end of a war, the sacrifices only grow larger, don't they? The winning side musters their forces and attempts to strike a decisive blow... While those of the losing side make desperate attempts to turn the war in their favor. Neither side will give. I only wish we'd consider those who lose their lives in that struggle.

speaker: Byleth
text: We're far from being safe ourselves.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, exactly my point. Let's be careful to ensure we don't lose our lives, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a necessary sacrifice.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Perhaps, but that doesn't make it any easier to accept your own survival depends on a throw of the dice.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's better than dragging the war out.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I can appreciate that, but just because a choice is better does not mean that it's good.

speaker: Caspar
text: It's such a relief that we've made it this far without having to fight my father.

speaker: Byleth
text: You'll have to face him at some point.

speaker: Caspar
text: Are you trying to scare me? What if he turns up while we're charging the capital?!

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds like you're scared.

speaker: Caspar
text: You bet I'm scared! The Imperial army hasn't lost a single battle with my father on the field!

speaker: Caspar
text: But still, I wonder what'll happen to him if we win...

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor! My, um, mother might be in the city. I don't have many good memories of her if I'm being honest, but she's dearer to me than my father, If you happen to see her, please make sure she's not caught up in all the fighting. She's only a civil servant, so hopefully she takes a cue from her Bernie and stays inside.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I keep thinking the war is near its end, then it isn't... When can we finally put this dreadful war behind us?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's end it with the next battle.

speaker: Dorothea
text: That would be wonderful. Imagine, the last moment of combat...then peace. It sounds like a fairy tale. I want to make this a world where there is no fighting, where children can grow up happy and safe.

speaker: Byleth
text: There can be no end to war.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I suppose you're right... But we should still try to make the world a place where children can grow up happy and safe.

speaker: Petra
text: Five years ago... Edelgard said a thing to me. Brigid is a vassal of the Empire. But she also said I always have the freedom to be choosing whether I am with or not with her. I will become the ruler of Brigid. So she said I must make my own path. So now, my path and her path will be colliding.

speaker: Lorenz
text: At last we've come to the final confrontation! Ruin to the Empire! Glory to Faerghus! Of course, to be perfectly honest, I would have much preferred to march against the Empire at the head of the Alliance. But I suppose I have Claude to thank for denying me that satisfaction, don't I?

speaker: Raphael
text: We're heading up to Enbarr next. I hope I make it back safe so I can tell my little sis about it! I hear they got a neat opera house there where Manuela used to perform. What was it called again?

speaker: Byleth
text: Mitreflanc Opera Company

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Byleth
text: Mittelfrank Opera Company

speaker: Raphael
text: Ah, that's the one!

speaker: Byleth
text: Mildewplank Opera Company

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Raphael
text: My little sis always goes on about how much she'd like to see them perform. I know we can't see a show, but do you think we could at least see the building?

speaker: Ignatz
text: We're about to put the finishing touches on this war. I wonder how Fódlan will look without the backdrop of death and destruction. I can't wait to see it! On the other hand, I'm terrified of what the future might hold. Who knows if I'll survive the assault on the capital?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Wanting so desperately to speak with Edelgard just as we're about to fight... Could it be that the prince is having doubts about killing her.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Then perhaps it is okay.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's only a formality.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I suppose they're the only ones who fully understand the extent of their relationship.

speaker: Lysithea
text: He's certainly changed from the vengeful person he once was. I don't mean that in a bad way. I'm actually relieved. A king who's responsible for Fódlan's future can't exact personal vendettas and have a cold heart.

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess...

speaker: Byleth
text: Praying again?

speaker: Marianne
text: Yes... I was praying for your safety.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you praying for?

speaker: Marianne
text: Um...for your safety.

speaker: Marianne
text: I'll do all I can to survive, but please...please don't die out there Professor.

speaker: Hilda
text: Fighting in the capital! Ugh! And we're fighting against Edelgard! Double ugh! But with you leading us, Professor, I know we'll win. Yeah! Wahoo! Fighting! I'm a little scared, to be honest. I'm just shouting to relieve the tension, but I'll be fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: At last, it's time to face the Flame Emperor... Edelgard. I know that the future of all Fódlan rests on this battle. Nothing else is more important. But for me, this is personal. For Captain Jeralt's sake, I'm going to give it all I've got and more!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea will be somewhere in the city. I wonder if she can sense us coming. The battle will soon be upon us. Let us both be at our best for what is to come.

speaker: Flayn
text: I was born in Enbarr. My mother and father met in the church there. Not too long after, I was brought into the world. I do not understand how war can happen in such a precious place. It is most regrettable.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Enbarr's streets are paved with unhappy memories, Professor. I've avoided the damned place since I abandoned my nobility. Swore never to return. Now here we are. To return in this manner... Well, I can't say it is something I ever imagined. Especially as I'm returning to end the Empire. What a strange feeling, breaking one's history.

speaker: Manuela
text: Life can be tough, you know? But if you've got your friends to help you through, it can be a lot easier. Maybe you butt heads sometimes...but that's OK. That's how you build bonds, right? And I've got friends, Professor. Plenty of those. It's true love that seems to have passed me by.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should relax.

speaker: Manuela
text: Relax? I'm relaxed.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's still hope.

speaker: Manuela
text: But where is my true love to be found? Where is my ray of hope?

speaker: Byleth
text: Time to give up?

speaker: Manuela
text: Yeah... I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

speaker: Manuela
text: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

speaker: Gilbert
text: It matters not how just our cause may be. In the end, war is nothing more than organized murder. I understand the desire to reach a conclusion, but we mustn't overlook the sins inherent in our deeds.

speaker: Byleth
text: I am well aware.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand, of course.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Heh, sorry, I have a tendency to preach. We have lost so much, and in return, we have taken much from our enemies. I pray we can put an end to this cycle of violence.

speaker: Alois
text: Here we are, facing the final battle with the Empire. It's been a long, difficult struggle. We have to get Lady Rhea back! And we have to crush the Empire, in the name of Captain Jeralt. He's watching over us now, protecting us. I know he is.

speaker: Catherine
text: Looks like we're nearing the end of this struggle. I'm sure Lady Rhea is on tenterhooks waiting for me to swoop in and rescue her.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Catherine
text: I was just kidding! Pay me no mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I doubt it.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oof... You don't mince your words. Try being a bit more mindful of other people's feelings.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea is not waiting for me, I know, no matter how much I might wish she were. She's waiting for you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Ten years ago, Dagda and Brigid attacked the Empire from the west. Their final target was the capital. But they were countered at a port town, long before they reached their destination. We spent a lot of time going back and forth, but at least we made it this far.

speaker: Cyril
text: Whenever I think about how we'll be seeing Lady Rhea real soon, I get happy and really get cleaning! We'll get there for sure, right? We'll see her again?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll meet her for sure.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know for sure.

speaker: Cyril
text: I just gotta believe Lady Rhea is waiting for us in the capital... We just have to find her.

speaker: Anna
text: Seems like the war is gonna end soon. Once the dust settles, it'll be back to rolling in fat stacks of gold for me!

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Momentum's really picking up for this final battle, huh? Even I'm starting to feel tense! Me! Enbarr's history goes back 1,400 years. That even predates the founding of the Empire. It's one of the sacred sites of the Seiros faith, so it's a pretty big deal. But hey, no need to worry about the monastery while you're fighting the final battle. I've got it covered! I'll defend it to my last!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor. Do you think Edelgard will show up?

speaker: Byleth
text: She will.
Well, well. It's been a long time, Professor. And hello to you, too, Dimitri.

speaker: Byleth
text: I doubt it.
Sorry to disappoint you, Professor.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard. I did not think you would actually accept my request.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Call it a whim. Well then? What did you want to talk about?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will get straight to the point. Why did you start this war? There had to be a way to change things in your territory without the need for so many senseless casualties.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It may be hard to believe, but this is the way that leads to the fewest casualties in the end. Don't you see?

speaker: Dimitri
text: How could I? Countless people have already lost their lives in this conflict.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The longer we took to revolt, the more victims this crooked world would have claimed. I weighed the victims of war against the victims of the world as it is now, and I chose the former. I believe that I have chosen the best path, the only path.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Even after seeing the faces of those who have suffered the ravages of war, you would still force them to throw their lives away for the future? You are obsessively devoted to this war and deaf to the screams of its victims. You cannot change the cycle of the strong dominating the weak with a method like that.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You're wrong. That very cycle is exactly what I have devoted my life and my power to destroying. If after all of this you believe the weak will still be weak, that is only because they are too used to relying on others instead of on themselves.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. Perhaps someone as strong as you are can claim something like that. But you cannot force that belief onto others. People aren't as strong as you think they are. There are those who cannot live without their faith...and those who cannot go on once they have lost their reason for living. Your path will not be able to save them. It is the path of the strong, and so, it could only benefit the strong.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh, so you consider me strong, do you? Even if one clings to their faith, the goddess will never answer them. Countless souls will be lost that way. Living without purpose. And I can be counted among those who have died that way as well. But that's why I must change this world, on behalf of the silent and weak!

speaker: Dimitri
text: And do you intend to become a goddess yourself? Will you steal the power to take action from the broken-hearted masses you claim to defend? The ones who can truly change the way of the world are not the rulers, but the people. Pushing your own sense of justice and your own ideals onto even one other person is no more than self-righteousness.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Maybe it is self-righteousness, but it doesn't matter. Someone has to take action and put a stop to this world's endless, blood-stained misery!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do you not believe in the power of people to join together and rise up? Humans are weak creatures. But they are also creatures who help each other, support each other, and together, find the right path. I have learned that humans are capable of all that from the professor...and from everyone in my life.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I doubt a highborn person like yourself could know how the poor feel or what motivates them.

speaker: Edelgard
text: This is nonsense. Thought, I'm finally starting to understand how you feel. But that makes it even clearer to me that we can never fully understand each other.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I feel the same. I finally understand...what you believe is right.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Good-bye, Dimitri.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Wait, Edelgard. There is something I must give you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is for you. Use it to cut a path to the future you wish for. And I will rise up to meet you there...El.

speaker: Dimitri
text: El! So it's true... You're really going away? Going back home?

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's nothing I can do about it. It's all happening so fast... I'm as surprised as you are.

speaker: Dimitri
text: El... Um... Here. I want you to have this.

speaker: Dimitri
text: El, listen to me. No matter how hard things get, you can't give in, OK? You've got to cut a path to the future you wish for, no matter what.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's...a dagger? Why would you give me something like this?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Oh, um... I'm sorry. I couldn't think of anything better to give you.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Edelgard! What are you doing? It's time to go. Hurry and get in the carriage.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Oh! I... I'm sorry, Uncle! I have to go now... Good-bye, Dimitri.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I...I remember now. You gave me a dagger, all those years ago.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Heh, I'm still sorry about that. I should have given you something that would've made you happier.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Perhaps. At the time, I was quite flustered by such a dangerous gift. I left without giving you a proper response...and that was the last time we saw each other.

speaker: Dimitri
text: True. It is a sweet memory with a bitter ending.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm afraid it will do no good to reminisce, Dimitri. That girl you knew back then is gone. As good as dead. But...I'll tell you now what I wasn't able to tell you back then. Thank you. My dear, forgotten friend...because of you, I never lost my heart. As for the future...that will be decided in battle. King of Faerghus. As the emperor, I shall await your arrival in Enbarr.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The gates to the Imperial capital have been broken. All troops, storm in! The emperor is within reach!

speaker: Gilbert
text: The Imperial troops are dug in across the city. Let's cut through them, and carve a route to the palace.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. The Savior King arrives, hands red with blood. Let's give him a royal welcome. Artillery, once the enemy is in range, fire at will. Reinforcements will fly in shortly. Keep your focus and hold steady until they arrive.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Reinforcements should be here soon. Let's draw them in... just like we planned.

speaker: Hubert
text: Draw them toward the opera house. Reinforcements will be here any moment.

speaker: Manuela
text: Has it really been so long since I was in that opera house? Couldn't have imagined any of this back then.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The battle is nearing the opera house. I hope everyone in the company is safe.

speaker: Flayn
text: That church... It looks familiar. I believe that is where my parents first met.

speaker: Seteth
text: Ah—that church. I've such memories of that place. From a time before I was Seteth...

speaker: Thief
text: War is for the wealthy. We don't even have enough to eat... I'm sure the goddess won't punish us for a little bit of thievery here and there...

speaker: Dimitri
text: More reinforcements, eh? And this time it looks like a fair number... It would be best if we could take them down from a safe distance... Is there any way we could neutralize the cannons or catapults?

speaker: Dorothea
text: The battle is nearing the opera house. I hope everyone in the company is safe.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Oh, that face brings back some memories. It's a shame we don't have time to catch up.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Manuela? It's not like you to show up anywhere sober. What's the occasion?

speaker: Manuela
text: I thought maybe we could talk. I could help you see the error of your ways. Or we could just try to kill each other over what we believe in. You ready to do this?

speaker: Dorothea
text: No... But let's get to it.

speaker: Dorothea
text: If it's our destiny to kill each other, then I cannot–will not–respect the goddess. My only request is that if you win, you'll at least have the decency to kill me quickly.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Edelgard, forgive me... I can't...

speaker: Hubert
text: So, Dorothea has been defeated. We will need to thin their numbers as well, or else. If House Varley's troops arrive in time, we may be able to flank the Kingdom's army...

speaker: Hubert
text: So, they've stopped our reinforcements. We will need to thin their numbers as well, or else. If House Varley's troops arrive in time, we may be able to flank the Kingdom's army...

speaker: Petra
text: For Adrestia and for Brigid! I will be defeating all of you!

speaker: Petra
text: Professor... I have been thinking. About why I came to Fódlan. To the Empire. I am here to be protecting Edelgard...and to be stopping you.

speaker: Shamir
text: I cannot bring myself to kill you... You're a princess of Brigid. A hostage of the Empire.

speaker: Petra
text: That was the truth in the past, but it is a different truth now, Shamir... I am... the will of the emperor!

speaker: Shamir
text: In that case, I won't hold back.

speaker: Petra
text: Edelgard... I will not be keeping my promise... Give me forgiveness, please...

speaker: Hubert
text: It's almost a shame to kill you. Not even death will make you consequential.

speaker: Hubert
text: I should have disposed of you a long time ago. I will rectify that failure here!

speaker: Hubert
text: Running into you in the capital like this-I have to say it's almost sentimental.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Hubert. She must leave.

speaker: Hubert
text: You really think you can make her?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: It does not matter what I think. Those are my orders.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hubert. I would tell you to get out of my way, but I highly doubt that you would abide.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. Your silver tongue will do you no good here. This is not your path to tread.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That is not your decision to make, nor is it mine. All I can do is blaze ahead!

speaker: Hubert
text: We must place our faith...in Her Majesty... Her victory is everything...

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's over... The way to the palace is clear. Let's move!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Send your platoons to capture Enbarr! There is to be no needless killing or pillaging, understand?

speaker: Kingdom General
text: Yes, Your Highness!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard awaits us. We will advance our main forces straight to the palace.

speaker: Byleth
text: We've finally made it here.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can win this.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, it has truly been a long war. And we have only made it this far because of you... Actually, no. I will save that sentiment for after we win this battle. We will advance our troops and confront her. We must strike down the emperor and end this war.

speaker: Dedue
text: My life is yours, Your Highness.

speaker: Annette
text: Let's win this and go back home in victory! I'll do the very best I can!

speaker: Ingrid
text: On my honor as a knight...I will not lose!

speaker: Mercedes
text: I know the goddess is watching over us. Let's be sure to return home safely. All of us.

speaker: Ashe
text: As a citizen of Faerghus, I will fight with everything I have!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh heh heh, is this what a do-or-die situation looks like? You had best give it your all too, General.

speaker: Felix
text: The path to the emperor is open. Fulfill your duty as our king.

speaker: Felix
text: Go and win. Be the boar you are, and don't you dare look back.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. I will... No. We will win this. Together! Everyone! Move out!

speaker: Edelgard
text: The time has nearly come.

speaker: Imperial General
text: Yes, the anomaly should present itself shortly. However...

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's no reason to fret. Besides, it's far too late to second guess. Now, assume your position. I can't promise your safety if you remain here.

speaker: Imperial General
text: Very well.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ugh... This pain is nothing...compared to what I have already suffered...

You… How long do you intend to sleep? Your body is awake. Your eyes must open now, and you must find the strength to stand upon those legs of yours. Like so much rain, a pool of blood has fallen to the ground… As spears and arrows pierce the earth, it weeps. And even now…it weeps. In order to survive, they kill. And so, the people of this world are lost in an abyss of suffering. They weep as well. The only one who truly knows the nature of such things is I… Or rather, you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm still sleepy.
You are a complete and utter fool! Have you not changed one bit?!

speaker: Byleth
text: Who?
Excuse me?! Are you saying you have forgotten who I am? How dare you!
Get on your feet. Right now! I'll coddle you no more! You are just like a child, always needing me to hold your hand...

speaker: Villager
text: Hey! A-are you awake?

speaker: Byleth
text: Where am I?

speaker: Villager
text: We’re in a village at the base of the monastery. What are you doing in a place like this?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who are you?

speaker: Villager
text: I’m just a villager here. What are you doing in a place like this?

speaker: Villager
text: I honestly didn’t expect to find someone floating away down the river… Garreg Mach is upstream of here, but that place was abandoned.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Villager
text: Huh? You don’t know? The Church of Seiros isn’t there anymore. Though there have been some folks still living there in the five years since… Well, you know. Anyway, I’ve heard some thieves have been spotted around those parts these days.

speaker: Byleth
text: Five years.

speaker: Byleth
text: What year is it?

speaker: Villager
text: Um, are you feeling all right? You didn’t hit your head or anything did you? It’s the Ethereal Moon of the year 1185. It’s been nearly five years since the monastery fell. Tomorrow was supposed to be the millennium festival, but who’s got time to think about things like that?

speaker: Byleth
text: The millennium festival...

speaker: Villager
text: Uh, yeah, that’s what I said. But with the war and the archbishop still missing and all… I doubt there’s a soul to be found who has enough blessings worth counting. Hey! Slow down, will ya? Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Byleth
text: The monastery.

speaker: Villager
text: Are you crazy?! I told ya! They say thieves are running amok up there, and there’s plenty of other dangers too. I heard a rumor that Imperial troops went up there to investigate and got slaughtered. Every last one! Come on, I promise I won’t say you’re a coward. Just forget about going anywhere near the monastery.

speaker: Villager
text: You just remember I tried to stop you, got it? It’s not on my conscience if you wind up dead!

speaker: Byleth
text: My students are waiting for me.

speaker: Villager
text: Students? You really are crazy, aren’t you? There aren’t any kids anywhere near that place anymore! Unbelievable…

speaker: Byleth
text: No need to worry about me.

speaker: Villager
text: Unbelievable…

speaker: Dimitri
text: I should have known...that one day...you would be haunting me as well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You... What must I do to be rid of you? I will kill that woman, I swear it. Do not look upon me with scorn in your eyes!

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Byleth
text: Everything will be OK.

speaker: Dimitri
text: ... You... It can't be! You're alive?! Hmph. If that is the case... That can only mean you are another Imperial spy. Did you come here to kill me? Answer the question.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course not.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ungh...

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm glad you're safe.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Am I?

speaker: Byleth
text: What have you been doing the last five years?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have been dead, more or less.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Dimitri
text: What do you hope to gain, asking me that? There are more important matters at hand...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do you not smell them? Filthy rats. Everywhere. And traces of those who were here long ago. And thieves, crawling from the woodwork, attracted by the promise of treasure. Heh… Since the monastery fell, order in the area fell right along with it. You must have seen the state of the town near Garreg Mach on your way here. Vile thieves run rampant. They pillage and loot to their heart’s content. I must kill them. Every last one. It’s time to hunt down their nest.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you plan to do?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I told you. I will kill them all.

speaker: Byleth
text: Even thieves are just trying to survive...

speaker: Dimitri
text: It doesn't matter what their reasons are.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't have to kill them to stop them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: They must die.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Someone must put a stop to this cycle of the strong trampling the weak. Or do you condone their actions? Do you believe that the pillaging and slaughtering those rats live for is justified?! It is reprehensible, and they must be put down! I intend to give them a taste of the pain they have inflicted on others. Even if it means becoming a rat myself. I swore to at least do that much… I will not let them down…

speaker: Byleth
text: How many thieves are there?

speaker: Byleth
text: Can just the two of us hope to prevail?

speaker: Dimitri
text: It doesn't matter. All that matters is killing those who deserve to die.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Good work. I should have known to check the monastery. Let's move, quickly!

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Dimitri... I'm on my way.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It smells of blood and sewage. Seems I've found their nest.

speaker: Pallardó
text: What the... Intruders! Protect the goods!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Shall we go rat hunting? Don't let a single vermin escape!

speaker: Gilbert
text: His Highness! And... Professor? We must speak later.

speaker: Ashe
text: I know it's been five years, but I never expected the monastery to end up like this.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh! I haven't seen any of you in such a long time! I'm so glad to see you're alive.

speaker: Annette
text: We'll help out from here! It's over, thieves!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Why... Why are you here?

speaker: Sylvain
text: The monastery has become a nest of thieves.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor! You're alive after all! But first things first–let's defeat these thieves.

speaker: Felix
text: I'll lend a hand. We'll catch up later.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Listen up. We must end this quickly.

speaker: Dimitri
text: There are openings to the north and south. We'll split into two and tear them apart.

speaker: Ashe
text: We promised five years ago we'd meet here and now!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Getting to see you and everyone else again makes having to leave my family feel less difficult.

speaker: Annette
text: Long time no see, Professor! I always knew in my heart that we'd meet again!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Where have you been the last five years? I was worried about you, and then I was just sad.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor! Has it really been five years? You're as pretty as ever, and that's the only thing that matters.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I'm glad we could meet again, Professor. It'll be nice to fight alongside each other. Just like old times.

speaker: Felix
text: Fancy meeting you here. A welcome surprise.

speaker: Pallardó
text: No! I'm not the one you want! Gah! I guess I've got no choice.

speaker: Pallardó
text: Ah, you should yield me a tidy profit!

speaker: Pallardó
text: I have no longer any reason to be here. Good-bye and be well!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Damn it, we failed to kill him...

speaker: Pallardó
text: I thought it would be easy money... Maybe it wasn't...meant to be...

speaker: Pallardó
text: It isn't looking good for us. Should we retreat?

speaker: Dimitri
text: You didn't plan on letting him get away, did you?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Your Highness! Professor! I'm so glad you're both safe...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Why are you here?

speaker: Ashe
text: Did you forget? We all made a promise here on this very day five years ago.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Dimitri, weren't you the one who asked that we all meet up here?

speaker: Annette
text: Don't be silly! Of course you remember our promise. That's why you and the professor are here, right?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness... I have been following news of your whereabouts for a while now. I am relieved to have finally found you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do not call me that. I am not a prince, but a walking corpse.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why would you say that?

speaker: Gilbert
text: That is what we all believed, but it is not so. I can see with my own eyes that you are alive, Your Highness. But the jail cells in Fhirdiad are as solid as they come. How did you manage to…

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue.

speaker: Byleth
text: What happened?

speaker: Dimitri
text: He's dead. He died in my place.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I see. We will be sure to honor his loyalty, Your Highness. As for the state of the Kingdom, the lords from the western regions have declared their fealty to the Empire, starting with House Rowe. Cornelia’s band of traitors now refers to Kingdom territory as the Faerghus Dukedom. They’ve made Fhirdiad their stronghold as they continue to invade the eastern region.

speaker: Byleth
text: Traitors?

speaker: Gilbert
text: There is much to tell you. I will explain everything in time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Cornelia?

speaker: Gilbert
text: She is a mage who has served in the royal family for more than 20 years. There is much to tell you. I will explain everything in time.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, it’s not like all of the Kingdom’s lords have sided with the Empire. There are plenty of houses, like mine and Felix’s, that remain stubbornly opposed.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness. Please allow us to take up arms at your side once more. What we need more than anything isn’t soldiers, money or supplies. We need the legitimate heir of Faerghus to overthrow the Empire and reclaim the Kingdom! Such is your duty. It is yours alone to bear and well worth fighting for. Only you can gather our troops and lead us back into the light.

speaker: Byleth
text: You are still needed, Dimitri.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see. So, you all agree that we must fight back. And you see how that woman…how the Empire cannot be forgiven. That we must wipe them all out until not a single one of them remains…

speaker: Annette
text: Wipe them all out? Umm, I don’t think any of us here are suggesting anything that extreme…

speaker: Gilbert
text: … Professor… There is something I would like to ask you. Please join me inside the monastery.

speaker: Gilbert
text: To think you survived under all that rubble for the past five years... I suppose stranger things have happened, odd as that is to admit. There is still much I would like to ask you... But I think that's enough for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is Rhea safe?

speaker: Byleth
text: Where are the Knights of Seiros?

speaker: Gilbert
text: On that day five years ago, during the battle with the Imperial army, Lady Rhea went missing. Since then, the Knights of Seiros have continued searching for her…and for you. I hear they have yet to find any promising leads. As the Empire has yet to release a statement, it’s hard to imagine that she has perished. And yet… Ah, never mind. Once news of your survival gets out, everyone will flock back to the monastery.

speaker: Byleth
text: What happened to the Kingdom?

speaker: Gilbert
text: After that battle, a certain...incident took place in Fhirdiad. Rufus, who was serving as king regent, was murdered. I was once a knight in service of the royal family… I resigned from the Knights of Seiros, and returned to serve the Kingdom. However…

speaker: Gilbert
text: This is madness! You truly claim that His Highness is the one who killed Rufus?

speaker: Cornelia
text: Oh, but it’s true. The only one who could slip past the bodyguards and kill so efficiently is the young prince. You can’t deny it.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Rufus is Prince Dimitri’s uncle! His Highness is incapable of such an atrocious crime as murdering his own blood!

speaker: Cornelia
text: Ah, but they were never very close, were they? It’s a well-known fact amongst former retainers. There are even rumors that Rufus was originally involved in the Tragedy of Duscur… Perhaps His Highness believed those rumors and murdered Rufus in a fit of rage. But I’m afraid none of that matters now.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Cornelia. Do not tell me that you...

speaker: Cornelia
text: The decision has been made. His Highness will pay for his crime with his head. His sentence will be carried out the day after tomorrow. On that day, the royal bloodline will come to an end. All you have left to do is sit back and watch, you senile old fool. Watch as the Kingdom you love falls to ashes.

speaker: Gilbert
text: It was soon after announced that his sentence had been carried out. With His Highness’s death, the royal bloodline of House Blaiddyd was erased from this world. True to her word, all we could do was watch as she tore the Kingdom apart before our eyes. Since the execution and the prince’s corpse were concealed from the public, there have always been those who believed His Highness was still alive… As for myself, I only began to hope three years ago, when I chanced upon some compelling rumors…

speaker: Byleth
text: What rumors?

speaker: Gilbert
text: An Imperial platoon attacked without warning. Incident after incident of Imperial generals being slaughtered in Kingdom territory. It is said that each died in such a brutal, gruesome way that…it is hard to imagine they were killed by human hands.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I followed the rumors to location after location. Eventually, I had seen enough. I knew the rumors were true. Finally, after a half decade of torment, it happened. I found him…

speaker: Gilbert
text: I fear his deep hatred, and the weight of his solitude, have consumed him for far too long… We must bring him back from the edge on which he stands.

speaker: Gilbert
text: To that end, I must speak with His Highness. I imagine it will not be a quick or easy conversation. I pray that he is of a mind to speak of such things. I am certain that my words will… Never mind. What must be done, must be done. I would wager that you are weary after the day’s events. Perhaps you should take this opportunity to get some rest.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We will finally have our decisive battle with the Empire this month.

speaker: Gilbert
text: The eastern lords are in the process of consolidating all of the troops within the entire Kingdom.

speaker: Gilbert
text: In addition, ever since Arianrhod's liberation, the western lords have been declaring their fealty one after another.

speaker: Ashe
text: Affairs within the Kingdom have calmed down considerably, and we even managed to win over the Alliance.

speaker: Annette
text: Although it was a rough go at first, I'm starting to feel like we could actually win this!

speaker: Mercedes
text: That's true! Thinking back on it now, we've really come a long way.

speaker: Seteth
text: We even have a lead to where Rhea is located. It is as we predicted all along. If we are to rescue Rhea, then we must defeat the emperor...

speaker: Ashe
text: Um, if we're going to march from the monastery to Enbarr, then we'll have to cross the Great Bridge of Myrddin again, right?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, I believe so. As we have gained the Alliance's support, we should not have any trouble this time. After the bridge, we can head across Gronder Field and head south. And then we'll take Merceus, the so-called impregnable fortress that towers on the other side.

speaker: Byleth
text: An impregnable fortress?

speaker: Ashe
text: Fort Merceus... I know of it. They say it rivals even Arianrhod.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Fort Merceus is praised as the strongest defense in the Empire.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Count Bergliez, the Empire's minister of military affairs, once had troops stationed there. But according to our spies, a large scale force has entered the stronghold. Perhaps they are gathering soldiers from various regions to compensate for their losses.

speaker: Byleth
text: Should we try to avoid it?

speaker: Dimitri
text: If we try to avoid it, those troops will follow us and attack from the rear. It is best for us to handle the situation head-on.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can we really prevail?

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is unlike you to worry so. But I feel we have no choice but to strip that place of its impregnable reputation.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Once we take Fort Merceus, Enbarr will be within reach. This is the Empire's last chance to stop us from arriving at our goal.

speaker: Sylvain
text: In other words, if we take this fort, then our blades will at the emperor's throat in no time.

speaker: Ashe
text: If this is the last fort between us and them, then the emperor will likely do everything she can to strengthen its defenses.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I just received a report on that very subject. The one commanding the troops stationed at Fort Merceus is someone we have crossed blades with many times. It is the Death Knight who awaits us there.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh... So that's who we'll be battling... Emile...

speaker: Dimitri
text: From this point onward, we're in all-out war with the Empire. Are you prepared, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am glad to hear it. That means we can approach the coming battles with peace of mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have already steeled myself as best I can.

speaker: Dimitri
text: First we capture Fort Merceus. The fighting will be undoubtedly be brutal, but... we must prevail. As far as this army and I are concerned, you're our last ray of hope. We are relying on you.

speaker: Dedue
text: Claude has stepped down from leadership, and Leicester is now a vassal state of Faerghus. The lords of the western Kingdom are beginning to declare fealty to us in greater numbers also. The Empire is our only remaining enemy.

speaker: Felix
text: We defeated Lord Arundel. The emperor must have been surprised. If we can keep up that fervor, perhaps we'll capture Fort Merceus, and move on to the Imperial capital. We must not be overconfident though.

speaker: Byleth
text: We're going to win

speaker: Felix
text: You're optimistic.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's proceed with caution.

speaker: Felix
text: Yes, I concur.

speaker: Felix
text: Human and beasts are ultimately the same. When they're cornered, they lash out however they can. They fight for their lives. Who knows how the emperor will lash out? We have to be careful.

speaker: Ashe
text: I wonder where Claude will go. From the sound of it, he's leaving Fódlan altogether. He was strangely gallant about the whole thing. Even left his Relic behind. Elusive and mysterious to the end, isn't he?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ya know Professor, laying a siege to a keep is like asking a girl out on a date. First, you get past her defenses...then you make your move.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not the best analogy.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. I'm a seasoned veteran at this kind of thing. Girls, I mean. I've never actually, you know, captured any keeps...

speaker: Byleth
text: You might be right.

speaker: Sylvain
text: See? You get it. Our fearless leader on the other hand... He's never been good with the ladies.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Anyway, I figure you go after the main gate. You take that out and I'm sure we can win. Of course, you're making the tactical calls. I'm happier to follow than to lead.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Death Knight... Going to fight the Death Knight...

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem concerned.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm... To be perfectly honest, I am...

speaker: Byleth
text: You'll be fine if you prepare yourself.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You're right. I'll have to face him eventually.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh, Professor! Good timing. You have to talk some sense into my father! Recently he's been doing nothing but work himself to the bone. Even when he's taking breaks from training and errands, he's apparently listening to reports. Day in and day out. He's getting on in years, you know? I just want him to take care of himself...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Just as we suspected, Lady Rhea was taken to the Imperial capital. We must get to the capital as quickly as possible. So many people are worried sick about her... I do wonder when Claude managed to learn Lady Rhea's whereabouts. He's pretty shrewd. I can't help but admire him.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The majority is with us. This conflict will end soon. I am so moved by the decision that Claude and the Alliance nobles have made. That is true nobility! Acting in accordance with the people's needs and wishes. As war drags on, those living near the front lines inevitably get the worse of it. Still...Edelgard will not give in. She will push to complete her mission, no matter how many people die. Not everyone with noble blood has noble ideals.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Attacking an impregnable fortress head-on is rather impressive... or suicidal. Depends on the day really. You know Fort Merceus's nickname, I assume. The Stubborn Old General? It may be stubborn, but its age means it's got to be hiding a few weak spots. Makes sense to aim for those areas.

speaker: Caspar
text: Fort Merceus is next, huh? Ah, the memories. It's a huge stronghold in my father's domain. The town's completely surrounded by high walls. I used to run around there when I was a kid... Way back when the fortress was just a playground for me. Yeah, those were the days.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I love a good fortress - the perfect place to hide! This one's impregnable too, isn't it? Perfect! As soon as we take it, I'll set up a special spot for Bernie!

speaker: Byleth
text: If we can take it, it's not impregnable.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I guess you have a point. What would you call it, then? A little pregnable?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's too big to make a good hiding place.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Now that you mention it, I guess it is pretty huge.,,

speaker: Dorothea
text: The Leicester Alliance is no more. Three hundred years of history...gone and done. They write operas about events like this, you know.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I'm sure they'll have a talented and beautiful songstress playing you. And with Dimitri at your side... Well, they'll probably contrive some kind of romance to keep things interesting.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Dimitri will be played by the most handsome actor of the time. Hearts will pound as he takes the stage. What am I saying? Surely the most handsome man would play you.

speaker: Petra
text: I have excitement in my heart for secret tactics! I enjoy attacks that are surprising. I thought we could be using attacks like that at this fortress. But I am hearing a different thing. A brute force attack with all of our power, yes? Attacks that are surprising are also safer. Attacking from the front has... is dangerous. But I will give you all of my fighting spirit, Professor.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It appears that Claude has dissolved the Alliance. He's thrown away the pride of all the Leicester lords who have walked the path of independence from Faerghus for generations! I said from the start that he was not suitable to lead!

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Byleth
text: But even you...

speaker: Lorenz
text: Well, times have changed, haven't they? I suppose we can trust the Kingdom now.

speaker: Raphael
