text: Wake up, eat, train, eat, train, eat, sleep. We gotta prepare for the assault, but that hasn't changed my routine!

speaker: Byleth
text: You're doing plenty.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can't you do more?

speaker: Raphael
text: All the training...and eating...I do is for the sake of Fódlan! Gotta stay strong...and fed...to keep it safe!

speaker: Ignatz
text: My family made it through the conflict unscathed. Thank the goddess! It seems that Derdriu was the only place to really get caught up in the fighting. Did Claude intend to spare the Alliance territories from harm? If so, he's a truly admirable leader. Speaking of Claude, I wonder where he is?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Something about Lord Arundel rubbed me the wrong way. There was something off about him. Not that I've ever heard anything good about him. Have you ever heard of the Hrym family?

speaker: Byleth
text: From the Alliance?

speaker: Lysithea
text: No, they're an Imperial house. Their territory is south of Ordelia's.

speaker: Byleth
text: From the Empire?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Correct. Their lands are due south of the Ordelia territory.

speaker: Byleth
text: From the Kingdom?

speaker: Lysithea
text: No, they're an Imperial house. Their territory is south of Ordelia's.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Since Edelgard's rule, Lord Arundel has been governing the territory. It seems like his reign was particularly cruel. The people there suffered greatly under him. He seemed to be a good and just person at one point. It simply doesn't make sense.

speaker: Marianne
text: Now that the Alliance has been dissolved, what will become of the nobility?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you worried?

speaker: Marianne
text: No, my adoptive father knows how to get by. I'm sure he'll do well for himself in the Kingdom.

speaker: Marianne
text: All of Fódlan is going to change... I suppose I'll have to change with it.

speaker: Hilda
text: The Alliance dissolved so suddenly. Now there's widespread pandemonium! The lords are warring! Mass confusion among the citizens! Or... that's what I expected to happen. None of that seems to be taking place. They had a roundtable meeting and talked it out. Everyone's dealing very calmly with the situation. I guess if Dimitri turns out to be a crazed despot, then there really will be chaos. But he's not going to go crazy again. He's OK now... Right?

speaker: Leonie
text: The Death Knight is guarding Fort Merceus. The same one who was linked to Monica and to Flayn's abduction five years ago. Anyway, he's one of the monsters responsible for Captain Jeralt's death. We have to defeat him!

speaker: Seteth
text: Fort Merceus is a keep that was constructed to defend the Imperial Capital, Enbarr. We cannot enter the capital without first capturing that fort. But once we have it, the city should be almost entirely at our mercy. Now that we know Rhea is there, we must move with the utmost urgency.

speaker: Flayn
text: The Death Knight. I shudder to think of him. Professor, you remember my connection to him, do you not?

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, what happened?

speaker: Flayn
text: What! You have forgotten about when I was kidnapped five years ago?!

speaker: Flayn
text: I am still working on the trauma from back then, all these years later. If we meet him, I swear I will have my revenge.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Fort Merceus is the Empire's single most fortified military installation. Utterly impregnable, they say. I wonder, do you happen to know the nickname given to Fort Merceus?

speaker: Byleth
text: The Silver Maiden

speaker: Hanneman
text: No, I'm afraid that name refers to the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

speaker: Byleth
text: Fódlan's Locket

speaker: Hanneman
text: That one is a fortress that stands at Fódlan's Throat.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Stubborn Old General

speaker: Hanneman
text: Indeed! A very good answer, but of course you'd know that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Seems Fódlans give everyone and everything a nickname. Why, you were called the Ashen Demon! Myself, I have been called the Father of Crestology, which is a nickname as well as a title, I suppose...

speaker: Manuela
text: Each step closer to Enbarr, I'm reminded of another part of my past. Riches and poverty, glory and failure, that city has it all! And if I'm honest... sometimes I miss it. That's how the past works though, isn't it? It's always a different story than what you really lived.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Even in the Kingdom, only a few people knew about His Higness and Edelgard's relationship. Me? I always knew those two to be like brother and sister. To think that we would come to see this world, where they are at war with one another... I live it, and I can still barely imagine such a truth.

speaker: Alois
text: So, Lady Rhea was in the Empire all this time. Wish I'd known that five years ago, but there's nothing we can do about it now. What we can do though is topple the Empire! Will you seize victory with us, Professor? For the sake of the late captain!

speaker: Catherine
text: We took quite the detour. It was time-consuming, but finally we got the information we needed. We crush the Empire, we get Lady Rhea back. Two birds, one stone. First, we take Fort Merceus. I'll put my heart in it. I'll crack 'em like a rusty helmet.

speaker: Shamir
text: Weren't the Kingdom and Alliance once part of the same country? If you think about it that way, it makes sense for them to unite. I suppose the Kingdom was once part of the Empire as well. Even if Fódlan came together, I wouldn't be surprised if it fell apart again

speaker: Cyril
text: Is it true Lady Rhea was taken to the Empire? Why'd they take Lady Rhea? Professor... they didn't take her to kill her, did they?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Cyril
text: That's good. We just gotta beat the Imperial army and get her back, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: They probably haven't killed her.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, good point. If they did, we'd have heard about it by now.

speaker: Cyril
text: You gotta help her Professor. I'm begging ya.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is it true that we'll be assaulting Fort Merceus next? That doesn't sound like the brightest idea... I've heard that it's built to withstand an attack from even the largest of armies! Not to tell you how to do your job, but don't do it! I'm not ready to say my final good-byes to everyone...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Fort Merceus... said to rival Arianrhod, the Silver Maiden. Perhaps a head-on siege was a foolish plan, after all.

speaker: Gilbert
text: No, you're right that it's the only way. I don't think the Death Knight would have fallen for any tricks. Even if they are denied supplies, they could hold a fortress like this for months. And we cannot discount the possibility that they will receive more reinforcements if our siege is delayed.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, my thoughts exactly. Then we have no option but to do the best we can. Say, Professor... In the past, it seemed the Death Knight took some strange satisfaction from his fights with you. He's an unpredictable opponent. A dangerous one. Please proceed with caution.

speaker: Byleth
text: No need to worry.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have not come this far just to lose you here. I'm serious. Do not be reckless out there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will you save me if I'm in trouble?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course. You were the heart of the Blue Lions, and the same holds true for the Kingdom Army.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Mercedes...

speaker: Mercedes
text: So, the Death Knight really is inside that fortress. Dear Emile...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I want you to know that no one is forcing you to battle with us at the front lines. I support whatever you decide.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Please, stop. We can't have you saying that. You and I are the same after all. We both have to fight our family for the good of the world... And since that's the way it is, I couldn't live with myself if I was the only running away from this battle. I will bring Emile back to his senses. I must. I'm his big sister, after all.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Understood. Stay safe out there, Mercedes.

speaker: Death Knight
text: That man approaches...

speaker: Imperial Solider
text: Report! The main gate has been breached!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Ugh... How did I get tangled up in all of this...

speaker: Death Knight
text: You are finally here... Will death's scythe claim you... Or will I fall to that sword of yours... And Mercedes... Here you are as well...

speaker: Death Knight
text: They broke through the main gate... Trample them. All save... that man...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Even though we smashed the main gate, Fort Merceus is still an ironclad fortress. And the enemy commander is the Death Knight. We must not falter in our assault!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I now see why they call this keep impregnable. Everywhere you turn is defensive weaponry. We must capture all of those locations as we push forward. If even one of them takes a shot at you, we will be in trouble.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Fools. Push forward and surround them...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Worrisome. They have a leader capable of summoning reinforcements. If we find and strike down that person, we can prevent further interruptions.

speaker: Gilbert
text: There will be no further reinforcements from this side. However, the other side is still in action.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If they call in more reinforcements, we'll be in great danger. We must take down the other commander as well and fast.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Good. Now we should not have to worry about any more reinforcements crashing the party.

speaker: Caspar
text: Did you have to kill a lot of your friends to get here? Cause I'm gonna give this fight everything I've got!

speaker: Caspar
text: It's way over my head, and I don't really get what's going on between you and Edelgard. I thought for sure you two would come to an understanding, but I guess I was wrong.

speaker: Caspar
text: Looks like we ended up on opposing sides, Linhardt!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Certainly seems that way. I could almost weep over how things turned out. Do you realize, Caspar, that this is the first time we've ever fought?

speaker: Caspar
text: Yeah, I think you're right. The first and probably the last!

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't worry about me... I always knew... losing meant death...

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'd rather not fight, yet avoiding it is more frustrating and fruitless than engaging in the battle itself.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Ever since returning to the Empire, I knew this day would arrive. I just hoped it might take a bit longer. Ugh...

speaker: Linhardt
text: I hope someday there will be no fighting and we can all just... nap the afternoon away...

speaker: Death Knight
text: I have no need of you.

speaker: Death Knight
text: You're stronger now. Whether I kill you or you kill me, I'm looking forward to this!

speaker: Death Knight
text: You dare stand between me and my pleasure?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. I dare stand against you, Death Knight.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Death is all that remains...

speaker: Mercedes
text: I came here to get you. Let's return together... Emile.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Leave... The place of your death is not here...

speaker: Mercedes
text: No! I won't! I... I refuse to run from you anymore!

speaker: Flayn
text: So it's you, Death Knight! Remember me?!

speaker: Death Knight
text: You again. Here to lose more blood?

speaker: Flayn
text: Never! You will not lay a hand on me ever again!

speaker: Seteth
text: You will not escape, Death Knight. Today you will be unmasked!

speaker: Death Knight
text: My true identity has no value.

speaker: Seteth
text: I will be the judge of that, once I've seen your face.

speaker: Death Knight
text: To kill, to die... To know one without the other would be maddening...

speaker: Dimitri
text: The enemy general has been vanquished! Everyone,move to gain control of the keep! Victory is ours! Raise the banner of the knights. May it soar proudly over the impregnable fortress!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh! I have to meet... I have to meet Emile!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Emile... I'm so sorry... This is all my fault for leaving you behind when I left House Bartels. I should have gone back for you sooner...

speaker: Jeritza
text: Argh...

speaker: Mercedes
text: I'm sorry for not being a better sister to you.

speaker: Jeritza
text: Mer...cedes...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Please forgive me, Emile...

speaker: Annette
text: Mercie, we need to go. Now.

speaker: Mercedes
text: ...Good-bye...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness, our capture of the fortress is complete.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Now the path to the Imperial Capital is finally opened to us. Once we've finished cleaning up after the battle, let's have another meeting to discuss our next move.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should have a victory celebration.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It would be one thing if we were at home or at the monastery, but to waste our resources like that here would be most-

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you overworking yourself?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Naturally. But it matters not. Consider this... Once this war is over, the mountain of official business on my plate will be even taller. If I can't handle at least this much, how will I-

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Pardon the interruption! We've just received a letter from Margrave Gautier.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Very well. I will read it at once.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see... It seems the conflict within Faerghus has at last come to an end.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Yes, Your Highness! The Margrave and the other eastern lords are at the center of it, and are gathering the Kingdom's military forces even now, They intend to join with the Alliance army and send troops and supplies to the monastery.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Whaddaya know... My old man is really pulling his weight. Did he seem well?

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Yes, as well as can be expected. He has taken it upon himself to bring order back to our troubled territory while His Highness is away.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am truly in the Margrave's debt. I will be sure to thank him properly at first opportunity. Thank you for the information. Now tell me, did it seem to you that my presence was needed back at the monastery?

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Well... I do have a verbal message from the Margrave on the subject.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A verbal message? How strange...

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: The other day, he arrested one of Viscount Kleiman's men. And, well... The prisoner has claimed involvement in the Tragedy of Duscur. He has implicated his lord as well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Go on.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: I was told they would be transporting this man to the monastery along with the troops and supplies. The Margrave said that regardless of the credibility of the man's testimony, how he should be dealt with was your decision alone, Your Highness.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Very well. All things considered, I will return to the monastery at once. Will you come with me Professor?  Thank you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We have annihilated Enbarr's army. If we strike her down now, this war will finally be over. I imagine she intends to keep fighting until the bitter end...If this is the end she has chosen, it is my responsibility to see it through with her. Isn't that so...emperor of Adrestia? We have no choice but to destroy each other...Such is the destiny we were born to. That is why...I will now rise up to answer her iron will with the bite of my lance.

speaker: Dedue
text: I will protect you at all costs. We will both live to see tomorrow...Your Majesty.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. If the king falls here, that would mean my father's and brother's deaths were in vain.

speaker: Ashe
text: For Lonato, Christophe, everyone...I will not lose!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, if I were to die now, I'd have a lot to explain to my brother.

speaker: Mercedes
text: All will be OK. I know we can win!

speaker: Annette
text: I won't falter, no matter who we're facing!

speaker: Ingrid
text: For all those who have lost their lives in this war...We cannot lose!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's win this!

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is time. Onward, to our final battle!

speaker: Hegemon Edelgard
text: They are here...But my progress cannot be stopped, no matter how many people try. The war's end will spell destruction for one of us. There can only be one ruler of the world...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard must be in the throne room...I would love nothing more than charge in and settle this once and for all, but we must be mindful of the surrounding forces.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Strange...The mages don't seem to be wearing their usual imperial uniforms.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Look at the mages. They are not wearing their standard Imperial uniforms...

speaker: Myson
text: We cannot allow our grand ambition to be stopped by these beasts...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Gah! Where did that attack come from?! If we do not find out, we have no chance of avoiding it!

speaker: Mercedes
text: We're in danger! Advance with caution!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Everyone, stay on your guard!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I can hear voices from the lower levels...Could it be enemy reinforcements?

speaker: Ashe
text: Maybe if we take control of those stairwells now, we can prevent reinforcements.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Avoid losses by taking control of the stairwells! Block the enemy reinforcements!

speaker: Dimitri
text: So...that grotesque creature was Edelgard...If she is prepared to transform her very body to fight for this future of hers... Then I have no choice but to defeat her, even if it costs me my life! We must defend the present... After all, it is all that we truly have.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Reinforcements from the lower levels... Will they ever stop coming?

speaker: Sylvain
text: General, calm down! Get control of the stairwells. Cut off the enemy's entry point.

speaker: Myson
text: We will return this world to mortal hands...May that filthy race of beasts wither and die...

speaker: Myson
text: A curse upon those damned beasts...

speaker: Mysterious Soldier
text: Myson! Everyone, retreat! We cannot sacrifice our goal!

speaker: Dimitri
text: The mages are retreating! So, those weren't Imperial mages after all!

speaker: Felix
text: Stop yammering! We must advance, boar!

speaker: Hegemon Edelgard
text: These fools are caught up in the sacrifices at hand and can't see the future ramifications at stake. We must bury them! We must trample the past underfoot and move on to a brighter tomorrow!

speaker: Hegemon Edelgard
text: You shall be obliterated! I will take you out so fast you will not have a chance to lament.

speaker: Myson
text: I'll take you down, here and now...For the sake of the new dawn...

speaker: Hegemon Edelgard
text: Facing you... I grow weak...

speaker: Dimitri
text: To be changed beyond all recognition.. That is what lies at the end of the ideals you served so diligently. I have no pity for one such as you. If that is the future you hoped for, then you deserve no compassion.

speaker: Hegemon Edelgard
text: Graghhhhh!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard...It is over.

speaker: Dimitri
text: El...

speaker: Dimitri
text: You made it.

speaker: Felix
text: We received a reply from my father. You should read it too.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Gilbert has filled me in on the details. He tells me you are in immediate need to additional troops. I would like to say that I will gather reinforcements and send them to the monastery at once... However, I cannot afford to leave the front lines for that long. Would you be willing to meet us south of Fraldarius territory in Ailell, the Valley of Torment? Ailell is halfway between the monastery and our territory. There, I will deliver the soldiers you require.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Valley of Torment...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ailell lies on the border between Kingdom territory and Alliance territory. Humans dare not approach that place.

speaker: Dimitri
text: He's right. In Ailell, we can meet up with them without our enemy ever finding out.

speaker: Felix
text: Once my old man delivers his soldiers to us, then our war against the Empire can finally begin.

speaker: Gilbert
text: The path ahead will be a difficult one, Your Highness. Deadly, in all likelihood...

speaker: Dimitri
text: True. But what's the point in wavering now? Father, Stepmother, Glenn, and even Dedue... I am certain this will bring them great joy. I know if I can just offer them Edelgard's head... I just know it...

speaker: Kingdom Solider
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Go away.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. I am steeling myself to see my father again. I can't stand that old man.

speaker: Byleth
text: But he's your father.

speaker: Felix
text: That's just biological circumstance. We may have the same blood, but we've nothing else in common.

speaker: Byleth
text: You really hate him.

speaker: Felix
text: Yes, I do. Above all, I hate the crazed nonsense that comes out of his mouth.

speaker: Ashe
text: The Kingdom capital or the Imperial capital? I don't know which is the right way. If we tried to take on the Empire like this, would we really stand a chance? With House Fraldarius under attack, they probably can't spare many soldiers. On the other hand, if we did manage to take the Imperial capital, the war would be over. Hmm... I'm no good at thinking through this kind of complicated stuff.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Aw, man... I really do not want to go there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Pull yourself together.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, have you ever been to Ailell? If you had, you'd know.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why not?

speaker: Sylvain
text: That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I don't know about everyone else, but heading to the Empire seems like a good idea to me. The search for Lady Rhea will be so much easier if we can just get the Empire out of the way. I suppose Dimitri might still pose a problem though. He seems so fixated on the Imperial capital, but... I get the feeling he's not even sure what he wants anymore.

speaker: Annette
text: If we can take back the Kingdom, we'll recover our soldiers. And some food and supplies too, I bet. Most importantly of all, there are people in the Kingdom waiting for our help. Even His Highness understands that. I'm sure of it. Yet he wants to take on the Empire despite all that... Do you think...he just doesn't care about anything other than fighting Edelgard anymore?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not true.

speaker: Annette
text: But if not, then why...

speaker: Byleth
text: You may be right.

speaker: Annette
text: He wasn't always like this. What happened...

speaker: Ingrid
text: It is imperative that we regroup with those who continue to resist. Most importantly, we must join up with the Fraldarius family. If we do, our ability to reclaim the Kingdom capital is ensured. We should aim for this outcome rather than focusing our efforts on the Imperial capital. This seems to me the best strategy at present. But I feel what His Highness feels--his hatred, his anger--so keenly, as if it were my own. So I find it difficult to oppose his wishes.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Some day we will take the Imperial capital. It is odd to think that I will be invading the very city that I once called home. Ah, that is still a ways off. I will prepare for our journey to Ailell.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I never do get used to the sight of blood. It always makes me feel as if I might faint. I suppose I've told you that though, yes? I've no idea how you cope with it. I hope this war ends soon. I dislike being lightheaded because other people are bleeding everywhere. Though the thought of working hard for it does sound like quite a pain...

speaker: Caspar
text: We weren't related by blood, but Randolph was still my uncle... Seeing him end up that way was... Never mind. It's nothing.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's how it goes with war.

speaker: Caspar
text: This wasn't just about war. It was a grudge. Or are you gonna tell me you're on Dimitri's side?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Caspar
text: It's fine. I don't need your sympathy. It's not like I had any real connection with him anyway. But Dimitri's methods... I don't know...

speaker: Caspar
text: I'm sure he never trusted me, being born in the Empire and all.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment? What kind of a name for a place is that? It sounds scary. Do I really have to go with you? Hey, um, here's an idea... Maybe let the recluse stay home and hold the fort!

speaker: Dorothea
text: This is all a bit troubling, isn't it? The people from the Kingdom seem to be of two minds, as well. Can we really plan to fight when we're this unsure of ourselves?

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe fighting will actually help...

speaker: Dorothea
text: You think once we're face to face with the enemy, it might help us band together? I hope so.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's hard to say.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Well, Professor, I hope you can bring everyone together. You might be the only person who can.

speaker: Petra
text: Since the past, I have learned much of the language of Fódlan. But speaking the Fódlan language still gives me difficulty. I can understand, read, and write with nearly perfection now. But understanding and speaking are...fruits of a different color.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's part of your charm.

speaker: Petra
text: I have gratitude for you, Professor. I hope that I will have fluency one day.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone has a weak spot.

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. I will keep practicing more.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ugh...so...hungry... I won't be able to train if I don't get some food in me! I used to eat until I was full, but nowadays I can't even get seconds! Aren't reinforcements supposed to be joining us soon? I hope they bring food along with them... I still want my little sis to live in the town here, but there's no point if we can't even feed her!

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Valley of Torment... I'd heard of it, but I never expected to go there. It's exciting! I wonder what the landscape is like.

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds dangerous.

speaker: Ignatz
text: It probably is dangerous, but I still want to get there and see it as soon as I can.

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds painful.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Hm, that is an interesting point... The name does seem to suggest that.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment, lies on the border of three noble territories. The Kingdom's Fraldarius and Galatea families, and the Alliance's Daphnel family. Incidentally, the Galatea family was originally an offshoot from the Daphnel family.

speaker: Marianne
text: Valley of Torment... Valley of Torment...

speaker: Byleth
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Marianne
text: I once read a book full of legends surrounding Ailell, but I can't seem to remember...

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you chanting some sort of curse?

speaker: Marianne
text: N-no... I'm trying to remember the legends surrounding Ailell...

speaker: Marianne
text: I feel there is something dreadful I'm forgetting.

speaker: Hilda
text: I heard we're headed to the Valley of Torment. I'm not exactly thrilled. That place is supposed to be really, really hot. Just the thought of it makes me uncomfortable.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't like hot climates?

speaker: Hilda
text: I hate them! You get all sweaty and sticky and eugh!

speaker: Byleth
text: You want to stay here?

speaker: Hilda
text: Ooh, that's not a bad idea! Though if our enemies attacked while I was here, that would be a pain too...

speaker: Hilda
text: Ugh! Who names a place Valley of Torment? A more inviting name would have been nice. Valley of Endless Summer, something like that!

speaker: Leonie
text: You're not a teacher anymore, and we're not your students, but everyone still calls you Professor. Is there something you'd rather be called?

speaker: Byleth
text: Professor is fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: Guess that's what we're used to, huh? All right.

speaker: Byleth
text: Call me by my name.

speaker: Leonie
text: Oh? All right, then. I'll call you--ugh. Nope! Sorry, can't do it. Too weird.

speaker: Seteth
text: Meeting reinforcements in the Valley of Torment seems an astute decision to me. In that land of oppressive heat, it is unlikely that we will be disturbed. It also means we will need to contend with those harsh conditions ourselves, however. Best ensure we are well prepared.

speaker: Flayn
text: It has been only five years, yet so much has changed. Half of the Kingdom has fallen to the Empire. Skirmishes are rife throughout the Alliance. Despite such tumult, we look upon the same sky, unchanged by the storm happening beneath it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you wish you could return to those days?

speaker: Flayn
text: Yes, it would be nice, I suppose. Things were...simpler then. Or so they seemed to be, at the time.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's true--it's just like it was all those years ago.

speaker: Flayn
text: Indeed. I gazed up at this same sky with Mother and Father. It does not feel so long ago at all. Wait, but how would you know, Professor?

speaker: Hanneman
text: The monastery repairs have made solid progress. Most excellent news. When we first returned here, I was unsure what we were going to do with the ruins of this place... But if we can get the cathedral rebuilt, we'll have it looking just like old times soon enough.

speaker: Manuela
text: Gilbert was a knight to the royal family of Faergus? What was a man like that doing in Garreg Mach, I wonder? Who knows. Whenever I try to ask about it, he'd change the subject and avoid giving a proper answer.

speaker: Gilbert
text: These past five years, Lord Rodrigue worried for His Highness more than any other. But I wonder what he would say if he saw what has become of Dimitri...

speaker: Alois
text: The Kingdom doesn't seem to have clear goals holding them together. Different people have different priorities. The situation right now is difficult. But at times like this, you have the opportunity to really shine, eh Professor? You're in charge. Show them what you're made of! I'll do what I can to help.

speaker: Catherine
text: Strategically speaking, our best move is probably to head for the Kingdom capital. Though, I think it's more likely that Lady Rhea is in the Empire, so I would not object to taking the fight directly to Edelgard. Hm. There are no right or wrong answers in war. What do you think we should do? I hope, with the goddess's guidance, we can make the right choice.

speaker: Shamir
text: There are enemy spies around. Remain vigilant. Capture anyone who seems suspicious.

speaker: Byleth
text: To kill them?

speaker: Shamir
text: What else would we do with them?

speaker: Byleth
text: All right, I will.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm glad you understand. I'm counting on you.

speaker: Cyril
text: Gotta clean out the storerooms, tend the flowers, do the washing, dust the library...

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds like a lot of work.

speaker: Cyril
text: Well, it's my job, ya know? Gotta do your job.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you need any help?

speaker: Cyril
text: Nah, this is my job. Lady Rhea herself gave it to me. Even if Lady Rhea's not here right now, I still gotta do my duty.

speaker: Cyril
text: Like you. You gotta have other stuff you oughta be doing, yeah?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is everyone setting out on a big campaign? Not exactly? Ah, so you're meeting up with the reinforcements. Well, you can leave guarding this place to me! I'll keep an eye out for anything suspicious!

speaker: Gilbert
text: This valley isn't a place I'd care to return to . . .

speaker: Ingrid
text: After the chilliness of Faerghus, I can't seem to adjust to this extreme heat.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Historically, there have been battles whose outcomes were determined in part by the climate. You can't argue that this heat isn't a factor.

speaker: Ingrid
text: In conditions like these, who knows what will become of our morale . . .

speaker: Gilbert
text: Professor, be honest. How are you holding up?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm at my limit.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Don't overexert yourself. Perhaps it would be best to take breaks as we proceed.

speaker: Byleth
text: I never imagined it would be like this...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Monks once used this area as an ascetic training ground because of the intense environment.

speaker: Gilbert
text: They say Ailell was born of the goddess's rage...

speaker: Byleth
text: Her rage?

speaker: Byleth
text: I hadn't heard that before.

speaker: Gilbert
text: If you believe the legends, this valley is evidence of the goddess's judgement...passed on humanity for its corruption. The forest that once covered the surrounding area was burnt to ash by a pillar of light that descended from the heavens. That legend fueled belief in a place of torment between our world and the next...where one's sins are purified in the cleansing flames.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Nonsense. Sins are not so easily washed away.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Indeed ... And there are no accounts of such a place in scripture. Yet those who cannot face their own sins have no choice but to cling to the idea.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Ugh, I just don't think I can take this heat anymore. I think I'm starting to see things... Near those mountains over there.... Is it just me, or is there a group of people gathered there?

speaker: Gilbert
text: No... It would seem you are not hallucinating after all.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That is House Rowe's banner. They curried favor with that witch and sold out Faerghus.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We messed up. There must have been a spy among us... Will you have us meet them in battle or wait for Rodrigue to arrive?

speaker: Dimitri
text: There is only one option. How kind of them to save us the trouble of killing them later.

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't they your former allies?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Never call those traitors our allies again.

speaker: Byleth
text: They sold out the Kingdom, right?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will not repeat myself.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That banner belongs to the Gray Lion. It's a waste of breath to exchange words with one such as him.

speaker: Gilbert
text: His Highness is correct. He is not an opponent whom we can expect to negotiate with. Everyone! Prepare for the attack!

speaker: Gwendal
text: The Valley of Torment . . . Perhaps a good place to finish off my life as a knight. Only if that puny force of children is able to kill me, of course . . .

speaker: Gilbert
text: That man, who raises the Lion's flag? Lord Gwendal. He is an elder knight who serves House Rowe. Gwendal would, without thought, fight any battle if ordered. There is no chance of negotiating with him.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ailell is a deadly place. Flames burst from the ground with no warning. Sane people usually avoid it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, the flames of torment burn your sins, your life, your everything. If you wish to spare yourself the goddess's wrath, tread lightly.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Here we go! Attack them from both sides!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: So Cornelia has planted spies even inside Garreg Mach.

speaker: Gwendal
text: The Shield of Faerghus has appeared! We can expect more out of him than the young ones.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: To meet you in a place like this... No, that won't do. I'll leave the talking until after the battle. Here's a small souvenir for you. Put it to good use.

speaker: Gwendal
text: Does a whelp like you really expect to kill me? I am Gwendal, the Gray Lion, a knight by the hand of Count Rowe! Do your worst!

speaker: Gwendal
text: Ah, so I have found a place to die . . . Young ones . . . I thank you . . .

speaker: Dimitri
text: The man praised as a lion is degraded to a mere traitor's underling.

speaker: Gwendal
text: A traitor's underling? That's upsetting, Your Highness. I am and always have been a knight of House Rowe.

speaker: Dimitri
text: How dare you? You are nothing but a lowly beast scavenging for scraps. You have forgotten the dignity of knighthood.

speaker: Gwendal
text: I may be lowly, but this beast is loyal to his master.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ha! Then I had better kill a pet and deliver its head to that master . . .

speaker: Rodrigue
text: It's been too long, Your Highness. But try to temper your joy, will you? This is a war, after all.

speaker: Dimitri
text: To say such a thing at a time like this. You have not changed one bit.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Don't let looks deceive you. I've had a rough go of it ever since I crossed blades with those traitors in Fhirdiad. When I heard you'd been executed, I rushed there as fast as I could, blind with fury. When I got there, I was fed some garbage about not being able to see your body. The next thing I knew, I was gripping my blade and... Gilbert, you have done well to locate His Highness. I am truly grateful.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: And you... I have you to thank, as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: As his professor, it was my duty.

speaker: Byleth
text: We were all fortunate.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Well, we are in your debt. I will repay you for this someday, I swear it. And you, Felix... You have also done well to bring His Highness here.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Tell us all you know, Rodrigue.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm afraid there's not much to tell. You are aware that the western region of the Kingdom was taken by the Empire, correct?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, so I have heard. They are now calling it the Faerghus Dukedom or some nonsense.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: If you know that much, then the rest won't take long. Enemy or not, it's undeniable that Cornelia's plan was nothing short of genius. After seizing power, she invited the Imperial army to Fhirdiad. There, she reorganized her troops and then sent soldiers to hunt me down. Because of that, we were forced to act defensively. And now we're being forced into a difficult battle. She's been controlling the situation all along.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So that's been the witch's plan from the start. I should have killed her ages ago.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness... Fhirdiad is in a terrible state right now. The tyranny is unbearable, and so the rebellions are endless. Refugees starve to death in the streets. If I may speak freely, Your Highness... We should change course for Fhirdiad and take down those traitors before we embark to Enbarr.

speaker: Dimitri
text: There's no time for that. We must annihilate Enbarr before all else.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Think this through. I understand wanting to destroy the Empire and the emperor. I want that so much it hurts. But which is more important, the dead or the living?

speaker: Dimitri
text: SILENCE.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: No, Dimitri, you will hear me out.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Are you asking me...asking the dead...to forgive that woman?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: No, I would not ask that of you. What I am asking is that you allow us to prioritize the Kingdom capital over the Imperial capital for now. As Lambert's close and trusted friend, I am confident that he would have advised the same.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do not dare to put words in the mouth of the dead. They are your words alone, even if you borrowed their lips. Until I offer up that woman's head, Father will remain a slave to his lingering regret and hatred... Even now, he suffers. It is ceaseless. As we waste time with idle chatter, his suffering continues!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You are my king. Our king. Wherever you lead, we will follow. But Your Highness... There are those who take up their sword in the name of revenge, and yet along the way, lose the strength and composure to follow through... You would do well to bear that in mind.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Ah, I nearly forgot. Take this, Your Highness. The time has come for it to be wielded by its true master.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Areadbhar... The Hero's Relic once wielded by my father.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The very same. I managed to steal it back from one of Cornelia's underlings in Fhirdiad.

speaker: Felix
text: Understated as ever, Father. It must have been a true struggle to get it back.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I... I am grateful, my friend.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Gilbert, Professor. May I request something of you? I wish to fight at your side.

speaker: Felix
text: Senile already, old man? Who will protect our territory?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I expected it would come to this, so I left those matters to my younger brother. He has my complete faith. I must keep my promise to our fallen king...to my dear friend.

speaker: Byleth
text: What promise?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: A very old one. I swore it nearly 10 years ago. Now then, Your Highness. Let's destroy the Empire together. My men and I will spare no effort. I pray that you are right...and that this will save the Kingdom.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Our orders are to capture Enbarr by striking the enemy stronghold directly... How familiar are you with the geography of Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: Very familiar.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Then you must be aware that the Kingdom and the Empire are separated by the impassable Oghma Mountains, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not very familiar.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The Kingdom and the Empire are separated by the impassable Oghma Mountains.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Legend has it that Saint Seiros once crossed over those mountains to fight against the Fell King Nemesis... But don't fool yourself. Leading an army over such steep mountains would be near impossible.

speaker: Gilbert
text: In order to infiltrate the Empire, we have no choice but to go around the mountains, either to the east or to the west.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go east.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Yes, I agree.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go west.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Hmm. I believe that may be difficult. After all, the western region of the Kingdom is already loyal to the Empire. Perhaps we should consider going east...using the route that passes through Alliance territory.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The Alliance is currently split in two. Those who stand with the Empire and those who are against it. Leading the Imperial faction is House Gloucester, while House Riegan leads those who oppose. We should take advantage of their internal conflict and proceed east along the mountains until we reach the Great Bridge of Myrddin in Alliance territory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why there?

speaker: Gilbert
text: The Airmid River divides Alliance and Empire territory. There are many large bridges that cross it. However, the Great Bridge of Myrddin is by far the largest, and it is also the closest to the monastery. I believe you crossed that bridge five years ago on your journey to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's risky...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm afraid we have no other option. This is our only hope.

speaker: Byleth
text: What if the Empire and the Alliance both attack?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I'm afraid it's a possibility. But it's still more practical than passing through the west.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Perhaps our next move should be to contact House Riegan and request their cooperation...

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you think they'll help us?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Claude of House Riegan is the leader of the Alliance and is firmly against the Empire. They are the enemy of our enemy... In other words, hopefully a friend.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Are you suggesting that we ask House Riegan to engage the Gloucester soldiers?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I am. If we take the bridge, then House Gloucester will no longer be able to receive help from the Empire. There's no way a man as wise as Claude would refuse our request.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: And once we manage to capture the Great Bridge and gain a foothold into the Empire...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Then we cross Gronder Field and head south toward Enbarr.

speaker: Ashe
text: But if we get attacked from both sides, we'll have to fight people from the Alliance, won't we?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Speaking of House Gloucester, I wonder how Lorenz is holding up...

speaker: Annette
text: If we meet him again, it will probably be as enemies. To be honest, I'd rather avoid seeing him altogether.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If you do not wish to kill familiar faces, do not tarry over the corpses of the dead.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. Good advice.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Prepare yourselves. It is time to steel your souls for the task at hand.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Our victory at Gronder was certainly a turning point for us. However... Rodrigue's death has been difficult to bear. We've lost considerable military strength and resources.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are there no lords we can rely on?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there no way to secure more soldiers?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Unfortunately, with things as they are now, I don't think House Gautier has any resources to spare.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I'm sorry. I really wish we could help. If only house Galatea had anything to give...

speaker: Gilbert
text: If we split up the soldiers currently defending the monastery, we should have sufficient numbers to invade the Empire. But even then...

speaker: Dedue
text: Your highness! You should be resting. Your wounds are still healing...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am well, I assure you. More importantly... may I have a moment of your time?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Thank you. I wish to apologize. To all of you. I have led you down this dark path with me, and have cost so much suffering along the way... I cannot tell you how sorry I am for my behavior. There is no apology I could offer that would be sufficient.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. And how do you intend to make up for my father's death?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Felix... I realize words alone are not enough to repent, but I fear they are all I have.

speaker: Felix
text: I’m not after more empty words. I want you to speak through your actions.

speaker: Dimitri
text: ... I know that no amount of regret can ever bring back the lives we have lost. I... I know that well. It is like patching up a tear with a different material. Things can never be as they were. The best I can hope for is to make things whole again. I wish to do the right thing from now on.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That is why I have made a decision... I intend to take back the kingdom capital. I wish to save our people, those who I turned my back on for far too long. To follow my heart and do the right thing... That's the only way I can atone for my sins.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your highness... If we can win back Fhirdiad, it will give us the advantage in our war against the Empire. As one who has served the royal family for ages, know that your words bring me great joy. And pride. That said, I must point out that if we make for Fhirdiad, the Emperor's head will slip further out of reach. Can you live with that?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I still hold hatred in my heart for her and for the ones responsible for the tragedy... That, I will carry with me until death.

speaker: Dimitri
text: But... my life is my own. It belongs to no one else, and it is high time that I started living for what I believe in. I will no longer allow the voices of the dead to bind me. This is something that I must do... No. Something that I am choosing to do. I will accomplish my aim, even if it means risking my life to do so.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Understood, your highness. So? Any objections?

speaker: Byleth
text: None.

speaker: Byleth
text: Count me in.

speaker: Seteth
text: You are correct. We cannot afford to die in vain by recklessly challenging the empire.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I'm worried about Lady Rhea... but if this is the choice you've made, I support it.

speaker: Dedue
text: I am at your command, your highness. I will follow you anywhere.

speaker: Ashe
text: My sword is at your service, your highness.

speaker: Annette
text: I'll help too! The people in Fhirdiad need us!

speaker: Felix
text: Fine. I'll help you...in my father's stead. But in return, you must win. You know that, don't you...Dimitri?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I do. And I swear on my father's lance that we will prevail.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Then it is decided. It seems this war council has much to discuss. Our next stop is Fhirdiad, the Kingdom capital. For the future of Faerghus!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I really caused trouble for you, didn't I... I am so sorry. Truly. I am also...eternally grateful to you. Now, it's time to go to the Kingdom capital. I hope that you will lend me your strength once again.

speaker: Dedue
text: Everyone is saying His Highness is back to his old self, but I do not think that is accurate. What he was until recently is what he had been for as long as I've known him. So tortured by his compassion for the fallen that it had driven him mad. He has always been too kind to be king. He has always felt too much for the weak and the dead. That is exactly why I look up to him.

speaker: Felix
text: He'll need to excel as a leader, if he's to make up for my old man's death. Though if my father could see Dimitri now, he'd be glad to have made the sacrifice. Don't you dare tell anyone I said that.

speaker: Ashe
text: I was born and raised in Faerghus, but I've never actually been to Fhirdiad. Do you think it'll still be cold at this time of year? I can't even imagine.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should prepare for the cold.

speaker: Ashe
text: You're right. It's an important battle, so let's make sure we're ready for anything.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe we should ask someone.

speaker: Ashe
text: Good point. I'll check with His Highness.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I don't feel like I can just forget all the awful stuff he's done... But if His Highness is owning up to his past, and trying to move forward... I figure I can give him that chance. We've been friends since we were kids. I'm gonna be there for him all the way to the end.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I agree that we should head for Fhirdiad, but let's not forget our search for Lady Rhea! The soldiers from the church are going to set up a base at the Great Bridge of Myrddin. They'll be able to keep up the search while we head for the Kingdom capital!

speaker: Annette
text: The Kingdom capital... It's been way too long since I was there last... Oh, Professor! I didn't mean, ah.. It's not that I'm looking forward to it or anything.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have to hide it.

speaker: Annette
text: Ah! Please don't tease me like that!

speaker: Byleth
text: This isn't a vacation.

speaker: Annette
text: I know that! We're preparing for battle!

speaker: Annette
text: It's just... when I think of us finally saving everyone in Fhirdiad, it makes me a little happy. OK, maybe a lot happy. The Kingdom capital is under the tight control of Cornelia, who was ennobled by the Empire. Judging by what we heard from Lord Rodrigue, it sounds like she's a tyrant. But all of that ends soon. Let's get there quickly!

speaker: Ingrid
text: We buried Lord Rodrigue's body ourselves. There wasn't a time to do things properly. It pains me that I was unable to take him home to his territory. Once this war is over, I'd like to hold a proper funeral for him. For now, we need to focus on taking back Fhirdiad. All will be well eventually. I know we can win.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Dimitri hated the Empire with a fiery passion. At Gronder, driven by fury, he sent many good knights to their doom... Now he appears to be freed from that hatred. If he can make thoughtful decisions, unswayed by his emotions, he may make a fine king someday.

speaker: Byleth
text: Kings are only human.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: No, they are not. A king must strive to be a king first and a human second.

speaker: Byleth
text: Kings can't have feelings?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: No, they cannot. Kingly judgment has to be wholly separate from the emotions of the individual.

speaker: Linhardt
text: There are stories of Heroes' relics a thousand years ago of which we have no real evidence today. So many, in fact, that I'm led to wonder if those Relics are nothing more than legends. Especially since we know of relics like those passed down in the families of the 10 Fódlan Elites.

speaker: Caspar
text: Can you believe it, Professor? Dimitri actually apologized to me! Remember that awful business between him and my uncle Randoph? He just came by and said he was sorry for all of that. That was behind us so far as I was concerned, but even so... It seem like he's changed for the better.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: It's always so peaceful coming back here. But it's hard to relax knowing we have to go out on another expedition again so soon. And now we're headed to the Kingdom? That sounds hard! Oh, really hard! Don't you think?!

speaker: Byleth
text: It's going to be tough.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I knew you'd think so! I knew you— Ow! Oh ow. Can't believe I tried to hug you through the door...

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll be fine.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Of course you'd say that! Why'd I even ask?!

speaker: Dorothea
text: So many people died in the battle at Gronder... And here we are, preparing for the next battle, as if nothing happened the day before. It's almost easier to think of war as theater, with the stage an entire continent.

speaker: Byleth
text: Though the actors die, the show goes on?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Something like that. If an accident happens on stage, the next day's performance must unaffected.

speaker: Byleth
text: It really doesn't seem like theater.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Even if an accident happens on stage, the next day you have to sing as though nothing happened.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Everyone just pretends like everything is fine... focusing on their role in the play.

speaker: Petra
text: Taking back the land of home has the most importance. That is why I am fighting...all for my land of home. Actually, there is more... I am also fighting for you and for everyone here.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It seems we will soon set food in Fhirdiad. I used to live there, you know. Though that was before my time in the Officers Academy.

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you a hostage?

speaker: Lorenz
text: No, of course not. There is a school of magic there, which I was enrolled in for a time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you a traveler?

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's right I was enrolled at the school of magic there for a time.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Trouble within the Kingdom forced me to return to Alliance lands. There was much I had yet to learn.

speaker: Raphael
text: You know when you work your muscles and they start screaming? That means you gotta be nice to them. If your muscles are hungry, you gotta feed them, and let them rest when they're tired.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't see how you'd do that.

speaker: Raphael
text: Whaddya mean, how? You just gotta eat and sleep! It's pretty obvious...

speaker: Byleth
text: You can tell how your muscles are feeling?

speaker: Raphael
text: Of course! If my muscles hurt, then I hurt. If they're hungry, well then I'm hungry too!

speaker: Raphael
text: What's with the confused face, Professor? You look like you don't get a word I'm saying!

speaker: Ignatz
text: The battle at Gronder Field was gruesome, wasn't it? But perhaps it's irresponsible to look away—to close our eyes to the horrors of war.

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Ignatz
text: As survivors, we must ensure that all these lives were not lost in vain. We must see the tragic foundations upon which we'll build our future.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have to force yourself.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Thank you. But I think I do actually. As survivors, we must ensure that all these lives were not lost in vain. We must see the tragic foundations upon which we'll build our future.

speaker: Ignatz
text: May an age of peace rise from the ashes, so that all this sacrifice means something.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm relieved the the prince seems to have finally come to his senses. Though it's a really shame that Lord Rodrigue passed away. It really is. But now I think we're starting to see a sliver of hope for the future of Fódlan.

speaker: Marianne
text: I never used to care whether I lived or died... But after seeing so much death firsthand, I now realize how precious life truly is. I'm ashamed of how arrogant I was to think that death could mean so little...

speaker: Hilda
text: Fhirdiad huh? I've always wanted to go there. But I rather be visiting for fun, and during a warmer season. And going into battle? Not exactly an appealing prospect! Heh, I'm just teasing. I'll do what I can to help. I'm just so relieved that Dimitri is his old self again.

speaker: Leonie
text: Dimitri's completely changed. Or maybe I should say he's finally back to normal. Either way, I'm glad he's come around to the idea of retaking Fhirdiad. With our current troops, there's no way we could handle the Imperial capital. We wouldn't even get past Fort Merceus.

speaker: Seteth
text: It seems we are headed for the Kingdom capital this month. The Church of Seiros stands ready to lend its aid to you and Dimitri. It may be a roundabout route, but I believe this path will still eventually take us to Rhea. Besides—saving the people of Faerghus is just what she would want us to do.

speaker: Flayn
text: Standing face to face with those whom I went to school with. On the field of battle... How inhuman is—how horrifying. My heart feels shattered. It is my hope that this war marks the end of such foolish behavior.s

speaker: Hanneman
text: There's a school of sorcery in Fhirdiad, which is staffed by the top minds of magical research. The study of Crests and sorcery should not be separate. I've always thought I should pay them a visit someday. I never imagined I might end up invading the place with an army though. Not how I imagined it at all.

speaker: Manuela
text: Fighting with three different groups in the mix was as confusing as it was difficult to survive. Enemies and allies dying one of top of the other... What an absolute mess, huh? If only I had my infirmary out in Gronder, maybe I could have saved a few more lives.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I am very grateful to you. I could never have achieved this on my own. This is all thanks to you and Lord Rodrigue. This month, we will invade Fhirdiad by way of the Fraldarius domain. Leave the negotiations with House Fraldarius to me. You make ready for the actual battle. It is a tricky business, but we are taking our first steps forward.

speaker: Alois
text: The emperor was wounded at Gronder Field. What do you think is going on in the Empire now? The Leicester Alliance has really suffered a blow as well. Who knows what will become of them? From now on, we have to pay close attention to how the rest of Fódlan is doing.

speaker: Catherine
text: If we're headed to the Kingdom capital, that means we're further away from rescuing Lady Rhea. But it can't be helped, can it? Perhaps some people will question this decision, but I trust your judgement. Lady Rhea would want us to help in Fhirdiad. She'd scold us if we rescued her and left innocent people suffering.

speaker: Shamir
text: So we're turning around and heading for the Kingdom capital? Ridiculous. Tell him to cease this nonsense. Isn't there a saying in Fódlan. Something those with power knowing how to use it? If he's not careful, the goddess will send her saints to smite him. Not that I believe that...

speaker: Cyril
text: Guess what I noticed. I can see further than most other people can see. But I can't see figure the point of seeing further than an arrow can fly, since I can't shoot what I see.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could detect enemy movements in advance.

speaker: Cyril
text: I suppose I could see a whole horde of enemies coming and run away. That's kinda useful, at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could find our targets quicker than anyone.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, I suppose it could be real useful for finding Lady Rhea too.

speaker: Cyril
text: Thanks, Professor. I think I get it now. I'm gonna put my eyes to real good use.

speaker: Anna
text: A class reunion on the battlefield? That's...bleak. That must have been so hard on everyone. You gotta keep looking after them all. I mean, they still look to you for guidance, you know?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Fhirdiad is a city with a long history that goes back to before Faerghus gained its independence. I'd like to visit that place at least once before I die, but I'm afraid I have my own work to attend to. It's hard being so dedicated! Ah well. I'll go there for some leisurely sightseeing once Fódlan knows peace!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Fhirdiad... It has been a lifetime since I was last here. Five years ago, in fact. On the day before my execution, when Dedue helped me escape from prison. I killed soldiers from my homeland, stole weapons from their corpses, and made my escape, soaked in their blood. To think this is how I would return to the city of my birth, after all that has happened...

speaker: Byleth
text: You have Rodrigue to thank.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, Rodrigue gave his life to show me the way back to this path. You have risked much as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm proud of you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I do not deserve that. If not for you or Rodrigue, I would still be lost...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am glad to have you at my side. From the bottom of my heart...I am forever grateful. Let's win this, Professor. Let's all make it out alive and celebrate our victory.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness. The path to the castle has been cleared. We are making preparations to advance. Say the word, and we march.

speaker: Byleth
text: Give the order.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's time!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... Let us begin. Everyone! Listen well! This battle is for all that the Empire stole from us. It is a fight to reclaim the days of peace we once enjoyed. I give you but two commands—stay alive, and follow your heart. That is all I ask. The gates to the Kingdom capital are open. Join me! It is time to take back our home!

speaker: Cornelia
text: I thought I would see you again, little princeling. Heh, so stubborn. It must run in your family.

speaker: Dukedom General
text: Cornelia! The city is overrun with insurrection. It seems to be in response to our enemy's arrival. If we do nothing, our army may suffer damages. We should suppress the citizens immediately.

speaker: Cornelia
text: The people are rebelling? Ha! Let them do as they please. Or are you saying you have enough soldiers to divide our forces? Quite bold of you, with our enemy's most elite soldiers at our doorstep.

speaker: Dukedom General
text: But... What are you suggesting?

speaker: Cornelia
text: The city is going to be a battlefield anyway. Kill all who oppose us, even if they are members of the general populace. Go on now. You are needed out there.

speaker: Dukedom General
text: As you wish. May we find fortune in the battle to come.

speaker: Cornelia
text: Hmph. What an inconvenience the little princeling has turned out to be. And bringing that troublesome person along with him... It would have been much better if he and his sweet little stepsister had been good little children and just killed each other.

speaker: Cornelia
text: The preparations are all in place. Time to meet my old master. Ready the Titanus in the streets! Let's give them a welcome to remember.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Advance! Smash that traitor Cornelia and reclaim the capital! I will not lose... I swear it by the blood in my veins...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Bah! These things are surprisingly tough.. Are they being reinforced by magic?

speaker: Gilbert
text: If there is magic in use, we should find the source and eliminate it.

speaker: Cornelia
text: Weren't the Titanus enough for you? Well then! we had better active the Viskam!

speaker: Dimitri
text: That should stop the supply of magic. Now we should be able to land attacks on those things.

speaker: Gilbert
text: These strange devices and weapons... They are the Empire's? Unbelievable.

speaker: Cornelia
text: My, what a charming little guest. Let me take care of you.

speaker: Cornelia
text: Hm. I can't quite say that I'm pleased to meet you. Though I do know quite a lot about you. It would be nice if we could catch up a little . . . But I'm afraid it's time for you to die.

speaker: Cornelia
text: My, it's been a long time hasn't it, Your Highness? You've grown awfully strong.

speaker: Dimitri
text: How shameless. I bet it was you who killed my uncle and set me up. Am I right?

speaker: Cornelia
text: Hah! Too true! I'd already forgotten all about that loveliness.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'll kill you, you monster! You will pay for all that you have done!

speaker: Cornelia
text: Ah, your face brings back memories... Still alive, are we, Gustave?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Prattle on, Cornelia. Faerghus will not be cowed by the likes of you.

speaker: Cornelia
text: How very dull...

speaker: Cornelia
text: Well, so be it. Still, I'll give you a little gift ...

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's over, Cornelia. If you have any last words, now is the time.

speaker: Cornelia
text: Right you are. Very well ... I have an old tale that I would like you to hear, if I may. About something that happened ten years ago ... Something Patricia said about how she wished to see her real daughter again, no matter who or what she had to sacrifice to do so ... And about how I made her wish come true, at the cost of the king's head ...

speaker: Dimitri
text: The king's head? You mean Duscur ... You monster! You mean to say that my father ... everyone ... was killed by my stepmother?!

speaker: Cornelia
text: That's right. Her family meant everything to her... You certainly know that feeling, do you not? Ah, poor little prince. Unloved by the only mother he ever knew... How pitiful.

speaker: Dimitri
text: How dare you!

speaker: Cornelia
text: There's nothing left for you now... Nothing but despair.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Try as that woman might to spout nonsense to her very last, nothing could change the fact that she was an enemy of the kingdom. She sold out Faerghus to the Empire, forcing our people to suffer their tyranny... But all that ends today. No more blood will be needlessly spilled. Now the Cornelia has fallen, we will exert pressure on the nobles who were aligned with her. Perhaps we may yet find a connection to the tragic incident in Duscur. Once we do that, we will finally be able to prove the innocence of its people.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your highness... I am certain that would make those of Duscur who lost their lives that day very happy. I am grateful. And I am proud to serve a man such as you.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Come, your highness. You still have some responsibilities that must be carried out. Your people have been patiently awaiting your return.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do you mean... No. I can't bear to face them after all that I--

speaker: Byleth
text: We're going.

speaker: Byleth
text: You must face them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor... Right you are, as ever. I am their king, after all...

speaker: Dimitri
text: What... what is this?

speaker: Gilbert
text: As you can see, the people are rejoicing at the return of their king.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Even though I turned my back on them, and fled the kingdom in disgrace...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Even so... the spectacle before you does not lie. We are a kingdom in need of a king. A hero to save the people from their long oppression. Your highness... It is truly a blessing that you have returned.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do I really have the right to stand here? Will they accept me as their king? Bloodstained as I am... Am I fit to be king?

speaker: Byleth
text: If you atone, all will be forgiven.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... you are right again, my friend.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't cry, Dimitri. This is a happy time.

speaker: Dimitri
text: These are happy tears, my friend.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am finally home again... Faerghus... How I missed you...

speaker: Dimitri
text: It may be spring, but the nights are quite chilly here in Fhirdiad... Still, our celebratory feast shows no sign of stopping. Have you grown weary of the festivities?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If memory serves, you were much the same at the ball, all those years ago.

speaker: Byleth
text: I was going to ask you the same.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's not that I have grown weary... more that I find it difficult to be around everyone at the moment.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have just returned from visiting the graves of my loved ones. It had been a long while since I left flowers. I was always terribly afraid of going near there... But I could not stay away forever. You have taught me something important, professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Studiousness?

speaker: Dimitri
text: That too, of course. But what I am referring to is far more valuable.

speaker: Byleth
text: Swordsmanship?

speaker: Dimitri
text: That too, of course. But what I am referring to is far more valuable.

speaker: Byleth
text: Humor?

speaker: Dimitri
text: You never let up, do you? No, what I am referring to is far more valuable.

speaker: Dimitri
text: How should I put this... Perhaps it is most accurate to say that...you taught me how to live. If you and I had not reunited on that fateful day, I am certain I would have died a fruitless death on the battlefield. I would have foolishly challenged a horde of foes and, in doing so, needlessly sacrificed the lives of my friends and myself. But now, I have returned to my rightful place. I stuffle with what to say, when I know well that words are not enough to express my gratitude. You save me from the darkness...and guided me back to the light. Thank you, Professor. With all that I am, I thank you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you happy?

speaker: Dimitri
text: That...is a hard question to answer. I still do not believe I deserve happiness. These hands of mine have taken so many lives... Nobles and commoners. Adults and children. Perhaps a day will come when I have finally atoned for my sins...but such a day is not possible until after the war is over.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you still wish for revenge?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Revenge was never something I wished for... It was an obligation I felt I had inherited from those who died. I believed my life belonged to those who lost their own in Duscur. But what I now seek is something else entirely... I can say that with confidence.

speaker: Dimitri
text: But I digress... For tonight, our only focus should be to bask in our victory. After that we must prepare for our battle with the Empire. To start, we must absorb the Kingdom knights taken by the Dukedom into our own forces and reshuffle our troops. The lords will need help purge our territory of Imperial forces, and I will use my authority as king to gather forces from various regions... And we'll have to ask the merchants to lend us the fund we require... Oh, and we must request delivery of supplies at once...

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds like a lot of work.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Heh... Just thinking about it makes my head spin.

speaker: Byleth
text: Good luck with that.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I cannot handle all of this work myself, you know. I will be counting on you, Professor.

speaker: Dimitri
text: There is much to do, but it is all critical work if we hope to stand a chance against the Empire.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there no way to coexist with the Empire?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Knowing Edelgard, I doubt there is a path that leads to our coexistence.

speaker: Byleth
text: You will soon face Edelgard...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... I am well aware.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I believe we have spoken of this before... Everyone has something they simply cannot accept. As for Edelgard, I am certain she will never be able to accept the Church of Seiros. I believe that is why she seeks to destroy it. She is looking to revolutionize the world. In her mind, for the better. But even if she manages to birth a new world... it would be at the cost of... I wish to end this war through acceptance, not annihilation. Just as my people accepted me, I wish dearly to accept her. But I fear -

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Your Highness! I finally found you!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, I am sorry for slipping away. Has something happened?

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: An express messenger just arrived from the leader of the Alliance. Please return to the castle at once.

speaker: Dimitri
text: An express messengers? What in the world could Claude be after? I am on my way. Professor, please join me.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We have received a report from our spy. It would seem the Empire is gathering troops at Fort Merceus. This is undoubtedly in response to us taking the Great Bridge of Myrddin. Their numbers are more than double ours. We believe that the emperor herself may be leading them...

speaker: Gilbert
text: If House Riegan can reconcile with House Gloucester sooner than later... Then Claude can proceed with his plan to rally the Alliance lords, gather troops, and invade Empire territory.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: At this rate, three military forces will be clashing at Gronder Field.

speaker: Byleth
text: Just like five years ago...

speaker: Byleth
text: Just like the Battle of the Eagle and Lion...

speaker: Dimitri
text: If you wish to indulge in nostalgia, do it elsewhere.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm afraid the difference in military strength is far from negligible. While we are elite soldiers, I am still uneasy about this...

speaker: Gilbert
text: If possible, I'd like to request reinforcements right away. If we can rely on any of the major Kingdom houses for military support, it would be...House Charon, I'd wager.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why them?

speaker: Gilbert
text: House Charon has yet to declare fealty to the Empire.

speaker: Catherine
text: It is also...my home. I will make the request to my father. With things as they are, I don't think he can refuse. The church has long protected me. I am certain that any request from the church will be answered to the utmost of their ability.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Very well. We're counting on you, Catherine.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I suppose that is all we can do for now.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: So it would seem. Though, if there are any other avenues worth exploring, I would suggest...

speaker: Byleth
text: Allying with the Alliance?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ah, good point. We have no reason to engage the Alliance directly.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Even if we do receive Count Charon's aid, we still won't have the troops we need to face the Empire.

speaker: Gilbert
text: But if we join forces with the Alliance, then our numbers will rival the Empire's.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's join forces.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Agreed. It's about the only thing we can do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's wait and see.

speaker: Gilbert
text: If we wait too long, we'll lose the advantage...

speaker: Gilbert
text: For now, let's send a messenger, and try to figure out what the Alliance hopes to achieve.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: It's hard to believe this decisive battle will take place at Gronder Field... I image that place is full of memories for all of you.

speaker: Mercedes
text: We won the Battle of the Eagle and Lion back in the day. It seems like a lifetime ago...

speaker: Ashe
text: I can't help but remember, even though I wish I didn't.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Our feast after the battle... I remember it well. We all had so much fun together.

speaker: Annette
text: No! Please, stop it. I had finally put all of that out of my mind... This isn't right. They're our friends! We used to study together. We shouldn't be fighting them.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Why not march up to Her Majesty and remind her of that? Oh, that's right...because you want to live to see tomorrow.

speaker: Dedue
text: No matter who the enemy is, I will fight for His Highness.

speaker: Felix
text: Tell me, boar prince. Do we stand a chance?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Who knows...

speaker: Felix
text: If we lose, we'll have died for you. I hope you know that.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: That's enough, Felix. We must focus on the battle ahead.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Make your peace before we depart. It's kill or be killed out there. We will cross blades with the Empire, but it's possible we will also have to strike down the Alliance.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness... Do you feel no hesitation about killing your former friends?

speaker: Dimitri
text: If they must die, I will kill them. Nothing could be simpler.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I can finally kill her... Finally... I can avenge them...

speaker: Dedue
text: You have my sincerest gratitude. Circumstances, and my wounds, have prevented me from being by His Highness's side these five years. I am grateful that you have found him for me. I am once again in your debt.

speaker: Felix
text: As powerful as our knights are, we're outnumbered. By a long shot. This won't be easy. It's crazy to attempt this. I guess I'm crazy to go along with it.

speaker: Ashe
text: If we defeat the Imperial army at Gronder Field, what will our next objective be? I guess we won't have much choice but to try to take Fort Merceus, on the far side of Gronder Field. It's probably too soon for us to be thinking about that, isn't it? The battle just ahead of us is far from certain.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Say we do manage to take down Edelgard here... What do you think His Highness will do next? As long as there's a plan, I won't complain. I just, you know, wanna know there is a plan.

speaker: Byleth
text: Continue on to the Imperial capital?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah, I suppose that's the most likely plan since we're traveling with the church and everything.

speaker: Byleth
text: Head to the Kingdom capital first?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh, well, I'd be happy if that were the case, but I don't figure that'll actually happen. All this isn't just going to magically end the moment we kill Edelgard. It's gone too far.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh, well, if even you can't say, I guess it's not surprising the rest of us don't know either.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I suppose we should focus on the battle right in front of us instead of what happens later.

speaker: Mercedes
text: So, we're finally going to set foot in the Empire... I'm starting to get a little nervous. I guess there's a good chance we'll be fighting more old friends from here on out.

speaker: Annette
