text: The thought of fighting people who were once our friends...it makes my heart heavy. If it was gonna come to this, maybe I should have avoided making friends with people from the Empire and the Alliance to begin with...

speaker: Byleth
text: You might be right.

speaker: Annette
text: You think so too, Professor? I'm glad it's not just me.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think that's the right attitude.

speaker: Annette
text: I just don't know, Professor. I'm having a hard time with it.

speaker: Annette
text: It did often seem strange to me at the academy that we were studying with all these people from all over the world. But I feel like I've finally started to understand the real reason behind it. The more you get to know people from other places, the harder you'll try to avoid fighting wars with them...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Yet another grand battle awaits. Many will lose their lives.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no way around it.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I am well aware. This is war, after all.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's fight our hardest to stay alive.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Yes, let's. We must both make it home in one piece.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Even considering those we are up against--friends from a time now past--I won't hold back.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: We captured the Great Bridge of Myrddin, but the fight has only just begun. Enbarr, the Imperial Capital, lies far to the south, beyond Gronder Field. And waiting for us on the way there is the entire Imperial army, with twice as many troops as us. We had better brace ourselves.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I seem to lack the skills required to grieve for the dead. If someone has passed, even someone dear to me, I could stand about and wail or get on with my life. While I'm at it, that whole idea that we must speak well of the dead? I don't understand that either. If I didn't like them when they were alive, then why pretend to do so when they are no longer here?

speaker: Caspar
text: After we cross the Great Bridge of Myrddin, we'll be in my father's territory. We actually crossed it five years ago for the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. Remember? Ugh! This is terrifying! What am I gonna do? I gotta get a grip...

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't worry, I'll arrange for your funeral.

speaker: Caspar
text: You think we'll meet him on the battlefield and he'll kill me? The front lines cover a long stretch of land, you know! We might not even run into him!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll pray for your safety.

speaker: Caspar
text: Oh, no no no. You should pray we don't run into him at all! The front lines cover a long stretch of land, you know!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: So the campaign continues, does it? Well, allow me, as a professional recluse with ten years of experience, to volunteer for, um...staying behind. Oh, who am I kidding? The fighting won't stop until we've defeated Edelgard, will it? Or until we lose, I guess. But there's not much use in thinking about that.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The Great Bridge of Myrddin was considerably better fortified that it was five years ago... The bridge was full of soldiers...and they all died.  And Ferdie was there. We killed Ferdie, Professor, he used to be our friend. Do you remember those days?

speaker: Petra
text: Nobles who are changing allegiance, again and again. I do not have understanding for that. How can you trust if treason comes with ease? How can you be calling yourself a noble? I do not have understanding of the reasoning...

speaker: Byleth
text: They're struggling for survival too.

speaker: Petra
text: Surviving is more difficult without trust. There must be...some other goal.

speaker: Byleth
text: For personal gain.

speaker: Petra
text: Survival has more importance than that. Are they not knowing this?

speaker: Lorenz
text: So, Claude and my father have made peace. That is to be expected. They both prioritize their own interests above all else. So long as those interests are in alignment, they will continue to cooperate. And based on that reasoning, one might infer that the Alliance should be also willing to work with the Kingdom's military. I highly doubt Claude would refuse to assist us, if we were to ask.

speaker: Raphael
text: I gotta say, it's tough to keep the fighting spirit alive when you recognize your enemies on the battlefield.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone gets that feeling.

speaker: Raphael
text: So you can't avoid it, huh? How did everything get so messed up?

speaker: Byleth
text: You can run away if you want.

speaker: Raphael
text: Hey, come on! Even I know we can't do that!

speaker: Raphael
text: Just because we're fighting someone doesn't mean we gotta hate 'em! That's probably the worst thing about war. Win or lose, I still get a bad taste in my mouth.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Thanks to our victory, I've been able to study the Great Bridge of Myrddin at my leisure. And you know what? It's an astounding structure. So much history there. Imagine how much time and effort it must have taken to build something that big. Over water, no less! I hope that someday it will be opened up to the people of Fódlan--a historical site, rather than a military checkpoint.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm glad you're the one giving orders on the battlefield, Professor. I don't think we should trust Dimitri with that task... Although it's thanks to his obsession that we're wasting no time, taking the shortest route to defeating the Empire. I just can't see a bright future for this army, fighting as we are under the banner of a prince possessed. Even if we do succeed in defeating the Empire, I wonder what will become of Fódlan. I apologize. Whenever I'm with you, I speak more openly than I should. Please keep this between us.

speaker: Marianne
text: The situation in the Alliance has changed so much, but I haven't heard a word from my adoptive father... Do you think he's forgotten about me?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure he's just busy.

speaker: Marianne
text: If that's the case, I hope he gets even busier.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure that's not the case.

speaker: Marianne
text: I'm not overly concerned about him...

speaker: Marianne
text: I'd actually be happier if he really did forget about me. Everything would be so much easier...

speaker: Hilda
text: I heard the next battle might take us to Gronder Field. Is that right? Reminds me of the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. But of course, that was a very different time. When it was over, all three class heads complimented each other on their bravery. And then we had a party. But we can never go back to that, can we?

speaker: Leonie
text: I heard Edelgard is going to be leading her forces personally in the next battle. Seems pretty reckless to charge right into this one. I'm not sure I like our chances. What do you think?

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't worry. I can handle it.

speaker: Leonie
text: I don't know why you're so confident, but it does somehow make me feel better.

speaker: Byleth
text: As long as you're here, I'll be fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, how come you only ever flatter me in times like these? What am I supposed to make of that?

speaker: Leonie
text: Anyway, we've come this far. Let's just keep putting one foot in front of the other and see how far we get.

speaker: Seteth
text: Each time we press forward, our search for Rhea broadens to a wider area. I certainly hope we will find at least some clue, but I do suspect I already know where she is. If I am right, and she is in the Imperial capital, then we cannot save her until we topple the Empire.

speaker: Flayn
text: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion. Has it truly been five years since then? Can you recall whether it was before or after I joined your class, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Before.

speaker: Flayn
text: That is not at all the case, Professor. Your memory serves you poorly.

speaker: Byleth
text: After.

speaker: Flayn
text: I am glad you have not forgotten.

speaker: Flayn
text: It was shortly after I joined your class--I remember it like it was yesterday.

speaker: Hanneman
text: When undertaking research, the usual method is to form a hypothesis, then test it with experiments. Those experiments reveal facts and falsehoods, yet sometimes, they also unveil an exception. You seem to be that exception when it comes to my Crest research.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sorry about that.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Worry not, Professor. Exceptions are what make my work interesting. Why don't the rules apply to you? I will find out, eventually. I feel it is my destiny as a Crest scholar!

speaker: Manuela
text: I hear the next battle could be a big one, is that true? I miss the old days when, if someone got hurt, we'd rush them to the infirmary and make them well... But on the battlefield, there's not enough time to help. People die. Professor, don't be one of those!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Catherine will surely be able to convince Count Charon. All that remains is to wait for a response from the Alliance side... For now, there are preparations to be made for the coming battle.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Catherine has successfully convinced Count Charon. However... The knights we sent to the Alliance have yet to return.

speaker: Alois
text: Word just reached me that the Empire has stationed soldiers in Fort Merceus. If they decide to dig in their heels and defend the fort, we'll be in a difficult situation. I hear it's an impregnable keep, surrounded by high ramparts. Taking it would not be easy.

speaker: Catherine
text: Hey, Professor. It’s been a while... Well, actually not that long. If you’re here about the reinforcements, no need to worry. I’ve sorted everything out with my father. If the Alliance agrees to chip in as well, we might have a real chance at victory.

speaker: Shamir
text: Reconnaissance is becoming more of a risk the deeper we move into enemy territory. If I don't come back, assume I'm dead.

speaker: Byleth
text: I know you won't get caught.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm glad you think so highly of me, but we have to be realistic.

speaker: Byleth
text: Understood.

speaker: Shamir
text: Good. We have to be realistic.

speaker: Shamir
text: Don't waste your energy worrying about me.

speaker: Cyril
text: I gotta keep this place clean, and I mean properly clean, every day. Dust it, sweep it, everything. You never can tell when Lady Rhea might be back.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Hm? Oh, it's you, Professor. Sorry, I was a little lost in thought there. About all that has happened, and all that is to come... I'm sure the battles ahead will not be easy, but please take good care of His Highness.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! I hear we're sending troops to Gronder Field next. Is that what's what? That whole area is in the territory of House Bergliez. It's famous as the main granary of Fódlan. If we could capture it, we probably wouldn't have to worry about food anymore! Bread for all!

speaker: Gilbert
text: There's quite a bit of fog settling in. We won't be able to advance our troops very far in this.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: We won't be able to move at all until the fog lifts, no matter which path we take. We'll have to be patient and wait it out. ... Gilbert. No... Gustave. I would like to take this opportunity to speak with you about something. It's about the Tragedy of Duscur. There's something about it I just can't wrap my head around.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I'm listening.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I lost a son in Duscur that day. I exhausted every last resource I had to investigate what took place there. I was startled to find that...there wasn't a single shred of evidence to suggest that Lady Patricia's carriage had been attacked.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Go on...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Apart from His Highness, whose injuries left him on the verge of death, everyone else present at the time was slaughtered. Of all the victims, only the corpse of Lady Patricia, His Majesty's second wife, was never found. Isn't that right?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Hmm... Surely that means she was abducted. There was no evidence of an attack, suggesting they threatened her but did not kill her...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: But what reason would they have to take her? Would it not have been better to kill her?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Perhaps she had some value as a diplomatic pawn.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Nonsense. In the many years since that day, has Lady Patricia ever been used thus?

speaker: Gilbert
text: No... Not as far as I know. Then perhaps she was used for some political gain within the Empire.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Now that her daughter is the emperor, what reason would she have to keep hiding her existence?

speaker: Gilbert
text: It is possible she passed away after returning to the Empire...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Gustave, I know this is hard for you to hear, but just consider what it would mean if Lady Patricia was involved with that incident...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Silence, Rodrigue. I will not allow you to tarnish her memory like that.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I do not mean to imply that she arranged His Majesty's murder or anything of the like. But Gustave... I cannot shake the feeling that the tragedy was part of a much larger conspiracy. There is more to it than we know, that much is certain...

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Rodrigue! Gilbert! Please, hurry!

speaker: Gilbert
text: To kill like this...is inhuman.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: This is one of the knights who was dispatched to the leader of the Alliance. Tell me everything you know.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Sir! A soldier on patrol came across this knight a short while ago in a rocky area not far from here. Someone from the Alliance must have disposed of the body there...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Is this how the Alliance chose to inform us that they have no intention of joining our cause?

speaker: Byleth
text: Could Claude really have done this?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The Alliance lords each have their own motives. It's difficult to say for sure who was behind this.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe it was the Empire...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. I would not hesitate to believe them capable of this.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Whatever the truth is, the other knights we dispatched are in serious danger. It's best to assume that joining with the Alliance is out of the question now.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Even with Count Charon's support, this makes our situation grim...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I never expected the Alliance to help us. Anyone who stands in my way will be crushed beneath my feet...

speaker: Fleche
text: It is time, dear Brother...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Know that I will tear your heads from your shoulders. The dead must have their tribute.

speaker: Claude
text: As big class reunions go...this one's gotta be the worst in history.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Years ago, we fought here as classmates. But not today.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Kill every last one of them!

speaker: Edelgard
text: And so we fight on.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You have finally appeared, Edelgard. Now you are mine.

speaker: Claude
text: The Kingdom army doesn't look interested in joining forces. Let's take a moment and see how this Unfolds...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It would not be advantageous to take on both at once. We must stop the Kingdom and the Alliance from joining forces. I will create such chaotic warfare that will not be able to tell who is friend and who is foe.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Mounted units. Advance!

speaker: Petra
text: The center is in danger of being taken. We must be running to protect it!

speaker: Imperial General
text: There are enemies in the central area... We need to head there immediately to protect it!

speaker: Claude
text: Hmph. The Empire and Kingdom are mixed up in this battle. It's a struggle to target the right one. Such are the rules of Melee. We'll just have to crush anyone who isn't an ally!

speaker: Claude
text: They wanna crush us before the Imperial Army? Then we'll show them what we'll made of!

speaker: Leonie
text: Great! I may not have a Crest, but I'll give it my all.

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm not going to hold back. I can't let down my dear old Claude.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Those fools who went up the central hill will pay with their lives... in the crimson flames!

speaker: Hubert
text: The central hill is up in smoke. Suppose I'll have to quench the flames - with the enemy's blood.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Don't expect me to go easy on you. Because I won't.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I thought I'd be able to live...just a little bit longer than...this.

speaker: Claude
text: Lysithea... She burned too brightly, and faded too fast...

speaker: Ignatz
text: I am helping Claude build the future of Fódlan!

speaker: Ignatz
text: It's over for me. I did my best

speaker: Claude
text: I'm sorry, Ignatz... I wasn't able to save you...

speaker: Leonie
text: I can't hold back just because I know you. Sorry, but that's war.

speaker: Leonie
text: S-so this is it. I did what I could, Captain Jeralt...

speaker: Claude
text: Leonie fell? Did I underestimate the enemy?

speaker: Raphael
text: There's no way you're gonna beat me! You're better off turning tail and running away!

speaker: Raphael
text: Wow, it's sure been a while! You're a tough opponent, Professor!

speaker: Raphael
text: Claude... Take care of my little sis...and the Alliance...

speaker: Claude
text: Raphael! Don't worry, I promise to look after your sister...

speaker: Hilda
text: You didn't forget about me, did you? Maybe you should just let me go.

speaker: Hilda
text: I have to get out of here! I'll die if I don't.

speaker: Claude
text: Hilda, you've done well. Leave the rest to me.

speaker: Claude
text: So sad that our reunion should take place on the battlefield.

speaker: Claude
text: So, you're actually alive, Teach! It's a shame you aren't on our side. Anyway, isn't the Empire your enemy? Us fighting seems like a waste...

speaker: Claude
text: Calm down, Dimitri! What does it achieve, us killing each other here?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Move, Claude. I have no time to exchange words with you.

speaker: Claude
text: It doesn't matter what I'm saying, does it? You aren't even listening. But I'm not gonna budge.

speaker: Claude
text: Arrgh... I thought we had a chance, but there was no way to predict the movements of the Kingdom army. I can't afford to die here. I have to retreat.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Stay back! Stay back or I'll shoot.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor? Is that you? You're with the enemy. That means I... I'll have to kill you.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Wish I could've at least died at home... not in this big, stupid field...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Bernadetta, thank you. I'll make sure your life was not lost in vain.

speaker: Petra
text: For Adrestia and for Brigid... I will be defeating all of you!

speaker: Petra
text: I can't be fighting anymore... I must be retreating now...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Don't worry. You must live on to lead your people. Those fools who went up the hill will pay with their lives... in the crimson flames!

speaker: Hubert
text: You're interfering with the plan. Looks like I'll just have to get rid of you.

speaker: Hubert
text: Fighting on will endanger my life. Your Majesty, I must withdraw.

speaker: Edelgard
text: No need to worry. We still have some troops left. So long as I stand, we won't give up.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I will destroy both the Kingdom and the Alliance. Now, with one fell swoop!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I knew when next we met one of our paths would have to come to an end. Your journey ends here, Professor. Forever...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Stab your chest, break your neck, smash your head... I will allow you to choose your own death.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm not interested in methods of dying. All that matters is when death takes place, not how. And I have no intention of dying today.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm sure all of the people you've slaughtered so far thought the same!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I lost?! Just as expected, you aren't making my path an easy one. I must retreat for now. We'll meet again on the battlefield.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, you think you can escape, Edelgard?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness! You're alive! We have to retreat to the Great Bridge of Myrddin...

speaker: Dimitri
text: That woman...we failed to capture her. I'll keep pursuing. The rest of you, keep fighting!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm so sorry...but we can't do that. I understand how you feel, but the Imperial army is closing in!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'll kill all of them! No matter how many hundreds or thousands of them they are!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You... What are you doing here?! It's too dangerous! Fall back, now!

speaker: Fleche
text: Heh.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You...are...

speaker: Fleche
text: Have I caught you off guard, Your Highness? Aww, does it hurt? I bet it hurts reaaaal bad, doesn't it? But it's nothing compared to what my brother felt! You will never be forgiven, you know. I will never forgive you!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You... You must be...

speaker: Fleche
text: You filthy monster! It's time to DIIIIE!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Dimitri!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Gah... P-Professor... Do it now!

speaker: Fleche
text: Agahhhh! B-Brother... Help... me...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Rodrigue!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness... Are you safe? Please tell me... it wasn't in vain...

speaker: Dimitri
text: This punishment... it was mine to bear.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: There are no sins or punishments... on the battlefield...

speaker: Dimitri
text: NO! Don't die... Please, don't die! Father, Stepmother, Glenn... They all died and left me behind. Rodrigue... Are you to join the ghosts who shadow my every move? This is my fault... I... I'm the one who killed you, as surely as though I had wielded the blade!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Heh. Your Highness. You have one thing... terribly wrong. None of them... none of us... died for you. I'm dying for what I believe in... just as they did. Your life is your own. It belongs to no other, living or dead. Live for what you believe in. Dimitri... My boy... You really do look just like His Majesty...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: What are you saying, Lambert?!

speaker: Lambert
text: I am heading to Duscur. And before you start, nothing you could say would change my mind. You worry too much, my friend. So far relations with Duscur have been going smoothly, wouldn't you say? You of all people should appreciate how critical these negotiations are.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Of course I do, but... for the king himself to make the journey... You must admit that it's dangerous. And His Highness is still so young. If the worst should happen...

speaker: Lambert
text: Even if the worst should happen, he would be OK. He's a smart boy, Rodrigue. Even if he should lose his father, I have no doubt that he will grow to be a good and respectable man.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Lambert...

speaker: Lambert
text: However... If he ever starts down the wrong path and I am not here to set him straight, I am trusting you to do so in my stead, old friend. Promise me.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Lambert... My promise... I...

speaker: Dimitri
text: What do you want?

speaker: Byleth
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Dimitri
text: It doesn't concern you.

speaker: Byleth
text: It does.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Get out of my way. Now.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're going to Enbarr, aren't you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you really think that will appease the dead?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Silence. You have no idea what you're talking about. Death is the end. No matter how much lingering regret a person has, after death, they are powerless. They cannot even wish for revenge, much less seek it out. Hatred. Regret. Those burdens fall on the shoulders of those who are left behind. And so I must continue down this path! I already told you as much! It is far too late to stop.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're wrong.

speaker: Byleth
text: There must be another way.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do not waste your breath with some nonsense about how I should move on with my life for their sake. That is merely the logic of the living. It's meaningless. Those who died with lingering regret... They will not loose their hold on me so easily.

speaker: Dimitri
text: But you seem to have all the answers... So tell me, professor. Please, tell me... How do I silence their desperate pleas? How do I... How do I save them?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ever since that day nine years ago... I have lived only to avenge the fallen. Even my time at the Officers Academy was all so that I could secure my revenge and clear away the regret of the dead. It was the only thing that kept me alive... My only reason to keep moving forward...

speaker: Byleth
text: You must forgive yourself.

speaker: Byleth
text: You've suffered enough.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hmph.

speaker: Dimitri
text: But then who... or what... should I live for?

speaker: Byleth
text: Live for what you believe in.

speaker: Dimitri
text: What I believe in... Rodrigue said the same thing. But is it possible... I am a murderous monster. My hands are stained red. Could one such as I truly hope for such a life? As the sole survivor of that day, do I... Do I have the right to live for myself?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Your hands are so warm... Have they always been?

speaker: Seteth
text: You! So, you were alive after all.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor! It is so good to see you again. My brother and I were worried about you.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, thank the goddess... I couldn't bear the thought of letting Jeralt down by not finding you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Guess you lucked out.

speaker: Catherine
text: We've been looking everywhere for you! But...I see Lady Rhea isn't with you. Damn.

speaker: Cyril
text: Everyone was real worried about you, Professor.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Gilbert has told us everything. From here on, our strength is yours as well.

speaker: Manuela
text: Gilbert told us everything. We'll help you out however we can, of course.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Gilbert told us everything. We are at your disposal!

speaker: Gilbert
text: It does my heart well to see that all of you are safe. Now that we have all gathered, let's discuss our next course of action.

speaker: Seteth
text: We have two objectives...to overthrow the Empire and to rescue Rhea. I have no objections to joining forces with you. After all, our interests are aligned.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Nothing could be more reassuring than securing the cooperation of the Knights of Seiros.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's fight together.

speaker: Seteth
text: The archbishop entrusted all of her affairs to you. From now on, I shall comply with your wishes.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We'll make Garreg Mach our base, and prepare to make our stand against the Empire. There is a fair amount of damage, but we will at least have shelter from the wind and rain.

speaker: Catherine
text: Surely those Imperial jerks have this place staked out, right? It's a highly strategic location.

speaker: Gilbert
text: While it may be a strategic location, it's too far from the front lines to be worthy of notice at the moment. This area is inconvenient as far as transport time is concerned, so it's of little importance to their war effort.

speaker: Seteth
text: Even so, nothing slips past the emperor. It is safe to assume she at least has this place under surveillance.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Professor... What do you think about making this place our base?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no objections.

speaker: Byleth
text: Gathering resources would be difficult.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Yes, that is a valid concern...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Fortunately, there are still villages and hamlets nearby. And though I wouldn't call them abundant, we have war funds, as well. What do you think, Your Highness?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do as you please.

speaker: Annette
text: Hey! Don't act like this doesn't concern you! We finally reunited after all this time... We've got to work together!

speaker: Sylvain
text: She's right. In fact, why don't we all join forces and clean this place up a bit?

speaker: Annette
text: Ooh, yeah! That's a great idea! And it'll give us time to reminisce about all the good old days at the academy. I can't wait!

speaker: Dimitri
text: How carefree of you.

speaker: Ashe
text: It may sound trivial, but... Well, I think it's a good idea...

speaker: Gilbert
text: I understand feeling impatient, Your Highness. But patience is key at a time like this. If we fix up our base, it will improve morale, which will be sorely needed as we–

speaker: Dimitri
text: Fools.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's all settle down.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's all get along.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Stay out of this.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Please calm yourself, Your Highness. We are not your enemies.

speaker: Dimitri
text: My enemies say the same.

speaker: Felix
text: What happened to him? It's like he's a completely different person.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I feel so bad for him... Would it help if I brewed him a nice pot of tea?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I cannot claim to understand how he feels. However... The way he's behaving–it's as though he's being haunted by some unseen force.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm worried.

speaker: Gilbert
text: As am I.

speaker: Byleth
text: He wasn't always like this.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Perhaps...

speaker: Felix
text: Hello. I have a request concerning that...creature. I can hardly look at the thing in the state it's in. Do something about it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll see what I can do.

speaker: Felix
text: Please do.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think I can.

speaker: Felix
text: Don't just give up like that.

speaker: Byleth
text: Better to just leave him alone.

speaker: Felix
text: Don't just give up like that.

speaker: Felix
text: We tracked the boar for five years. I thought he was dead. In the state he's in, he might as well be. He's gotten better at killing people, and in exchange, surrendered what little humanity he had.

speaker: Ashe
text: Is...is Dedue really gone? There's so much more I wanted to say to him. He was always so tender with the flowers in the greenhouse. I wonder how they're doing...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Professor. It's been a while. It's really good to see you again. Gorgeous as ever, might I add. An awful lot has happened in these past five years. There were so many times I wished you were around. I'm glad you're back. Your skills are worth more than a whole army.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I finally managed to meet up with everyone again, but they're all so gloomy. Hey, Professor. Care to join me for a cup of tea? We could invite the others, and the soldiers.

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds nice.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Doesn't it? There probably isn't enough time to bake any treats though...

speaker: Byleth
text: Um, I don't know...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Don't be like that, Professor. When things are tough, that's exactly when we need to keep our spirits up and smile!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh! I should invite Dimitri to come along as well. Though I don't suppose he'll want to join in...

speaker: Annette
text: Now that I think about it, His Highness was right. We probably don't have time to waste on cleaning... Maybe I wasn't taking the situation seriously enough. After all, the Imperial army could be showing up at any time! I was just so happy to see you again. And everyone else too. Maybe I got carried away.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm happy to see you too.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh really? That's so nice to hear!

speaker: Byleth
text: Cleaning is important.

speaker: Annette
text: Well, I suppose Lady Rhea would be pretty shocked if she came back to find the place filthy!

speaker: Ingrid
text: These past five years, many Kingdom houses have become vassals of the Empire. The major houses of Fraldarius, Gautier, Charon, and my own family, Galatea, remain loyal... But the lords of the minor domains in the west have almost entirely defected. After all the royal family has done for them, they respond with betrayal. And to think they have the gall to call themselves nobles. But we still have His Highness, and you, Professor. I'm sure we can take back the Kingdom's lands.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I have lost my dominion. My nobility may seem like nothing more than a title. But I will never lose my noble heart. I will stop Edelgard, even if it costs me my life. I have turned my blade against her now. I cannot go back on that decision. Professor... Do you think I chose the wrong path?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not at all.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll find out soon enough.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You are right...

speaker: Linhardt
text: The promise was made five years ago, but I must say I'm rather impressed by how many of us managed to make it. Personally, I only showed up because I hoped to see you again, Professor. I've been with my family in the Empire until recently. I admit to feeling a little guilty betraying Her Majesty...but only a little. Now that we're all together again, I suppose the fighting will begin soon.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey, Professor! You won't believe what happened! I figured I couldn't go back to the Empire after Garreg Mach fell, so I started drifting across the Kingdom and the Alliance. Then I just happened to run into our old class, so we came back to the monastery together!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah, at last, I return to my domain! My lonely paradise! My realm of exquisite solitude! Huh? Professor? Is that, um. Is that you? You, um. You didn't hear that just now, did you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sorry.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh! Forget you heard anything!

speaker: Byleth
text: Hear what?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Right. You didn't? Well, um. Good.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

speaker: Petra
text: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be...difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means that common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will...ah, will turn. I have certainty.

speaker: Raphael
text: The Alliance is such a mess. How are we supposed to know where's safe and where's not? I should probably just move my little sis and grandpa to Garreg Mach. At least I could keep working on becoming a proper knight without having to worry about them! I gotta find them a house once things calm down a bit!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Oh, Professor! Seeing everyone together again, it's like I'm in a dream. I feel like it's time for me to forge my own path and find my own place in this world.

speaker: Byleth
text: What about your family? Are they OK?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes. They're in the Alliance, but they're merchants, so they have the means to escape if need be.

speaker: Byleth
text: How does your father feel about all this?

speaker: Ignatz
text: I sent him a letter. I'm still waiting on a reply, but I don't think he'd object to my being here. It'll be valuable for him, having someone outside the Alliance to keep him abreast of new information.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I should probably keep things to myself, but in all honesty... What matters to me, more than anything, is ensuring a peaceful, quiet future for my parents. I don't care about the Kingdom. I simply want to remove the threat of the Empire. Because of this, Dimitri's fixation on Edelgard is convenient to me. I fight for my own reasons and no others.

speaker: Marianne
text: Professor... Is there any reason for me to remain here? I want to be useful, of course, but I'm not sure anyone needs me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Then why did you stay?

speaker: Marianne
text: That was my adoptive father's decision. He has decided there is no future in the Alliance...

speaker: Byleth
text: I need you here.

speaker: Marianne
text: If you really mean that, I will stay and do my best to help.

speaker: Hilda
text: Garreg Mach is a mess. So is Dimitri, honestly. If not for you arriving, Professor, I'd be heading home about now. Though staying here is still more appealing than living with my big brother.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm so glad I found you here, Professor. Now I don't have to worry about what to do with myself. Captain Jeralt told me to look out for you, after all. So now my purpose is clear. I'll do everything I can to protect you!

speaker: Seteth
text: Five long years, I've searched for you and the archbishop. It is a pleasure to see you again. The Church of Seiros will follow you from now on, but please do not abandon the search for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll do whatever it takes to find her.

speaker: Seteth
text: Thank you. I know the battles ahead will be dire, but we will support you with all our strength.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know what the future will bring.

speaker: Seteth
text: Wherever she is, Rhea is doubtlessly waiting for you. Please do not let her down.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, I am so glad you are unharmed! No matter the path you walk, I will be with you every step of the way. Anything you ask of me, I shall see it through. You saved my life, and I am in your debt.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Thankfully, it appears the records and equipment I need for my research have not been damaged. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can talk about that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, maybe later...

speaker: Hanneman
text: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

speaker: Manuela
text: My, Professor. You haven't changed a bit! At your age, I'd expect your whole demeanor to have changed greatly over five years... Though I suppose I haven't changed either, right? Thank you for noticing, by the way. Ah, just the two of us, forever young.  Oh, let me have my fun.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We have given a proper burial to the Imperial soldiers kills in the monastery. The ones who were sent to investigate the thieves. Already, rumors spread that they were utterly annihilated. So regardless of whether there are spies observing us, the Imperial army will know of this soon enough. Your Highness...Dimitri... How could you be so reckless?

speaker: Alois
text: I'd given up on seeing you again. Where have you been hiding? Anyway, now that we're reunited in the land of the living, I must fulfill my promise!

speaker: Byleth
text: What promise?

speaker: Alois
text: The promise I made to the captain, to keep you safe! I can't believe you've forgotten. How cold...

speaker: Byleth
text: Right, the promise.

speaker: Alois
text: That's right. I promised the captain I'd protect you in his stead, and now I'll make good on my word!

speaker: Catherine
text: In Lady Rhea's absence, I will follow you. That's what she would want me to do. Know that wherever you might lead us, I'll continue searching for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's fine.

speaker: Catherine
text: Good, because I will not budge on that point. Welcome back, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

speaker: Catherine
text: I don't care how much trouble it is! I will rescue Lady Rhea, at all costs.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm more of a mercenary than a knight these days. I work to get paid. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon... But I might change my mind if you're around.

speaker: Cyril
text: I don't know anything about rebuilding, but I can sure do my best to clean up the mess. I'm gonna keep Lady Rhea's room spotless, so she can use it right away whenever she gets back.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You know, it's such a thrill to be able to greet you like this again! I almost died as well in the battle five years ago, but I won't allow any enemies to get into this place again. I promise you that! Even if the Death Knight shows up, I'll be sure to... Well, for now I'll keep training so I can eventually feel confident that I can stop him!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're wrong.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's not like that, Glenn. I swear it. Any love I once had for my stepsister...has been tossed aside. Only hatred remains. If I could tear that woman to shreds right this very moment, I would. I don't care if she's the emperor. It's no different than killing anyone else. So I beg you...all of you... Do not worry about my resolve. Please, Father... And you too, Stepmother... Do not gaze at me with that look in your eyes... I will bring you her head soon. And when I do, you may finally rest in peace. I know it... Yes, I know it...

speaker: Byleth
text: Snap out of it, Dimitri.

speaker: Byleth
text: What is troubling you?

speaker: Dimitri
text: What do you want?

speaker: Byleth
text: I came to check on you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone is worried about you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see. We should make haste and prepare to move out at once. I must kill her as soon as possible...

speaker: Byleth
text: That would be rash.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I don't have time to leisurely set up camp like the rest of you fools!

speaker: Byleth
text: We must first prepare.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We have no time to leisurely set up camp. If I must, I will go by myself.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Pardon the interruption. We must prepare a counterattack at once. The Imperial army has caught wind of our position. It would seem they were patrolling this place, after all.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Imperial army, is it? Well, well. Hehehe...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Your Highness... I ask that you please refrain from reckless behavior in battle.

speaker: Randolph
text: It would seem the report that the Knights of Seiros have returned was accurate. This is going to take some effort.

speaker: Fleche
text: Brother... I heard a rumor that there is a vicious murderer among our enemies.

speaker: Randolph
text: Who knows if there's any truth to it. Thought I admit we have lost some soldiers recently. Whether he's among them or not, taking on the Knights of Seiros is extremely dangerous. You're not ready for the front lines, Fleche. Stay in the back and support us from there. Understood?

speaker: Fleche
text: No! I want to stay with you! I have to–

speaker: Randolph
text: I need you to understand, Fleche. I will come back. I promise.

speaker: Fleche
text: Fine. I trust you, Brother. Please...be safe.

speaker: Randolph
text: All units, prepare to attack!

speaker: Randolph
text: The Knights of Seiros are a powerful enemy, but we have more soldiers. We'll take them down all at once!

speaker: Gilbert
text: There are more enemies than expected. Attacking with fire would prove most useful here.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Report! The enemy has entered the periphery of Garreg Mach!

speaker: Gilbert
text: If they reach the interior, we won't be able to protect the monastery. Drive them back!

speaker: Gilbert
text: It is our duty to give these soldiers to their destination. Stay alert. An attack may come at any time.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Damn! We couldn't protect the monastery. We must accept defeat.

speaker: Randolph
text: A total loss... But we can't just return home like this...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor! Get down!

speaker: Gilbert
text: The fire attack unit has been destroyed. Our plan has failed.

speaker: Randolph
text: It looks like they were planning something, but it failed!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Fire attack is ready. Now to draw the enemy's attention. So many units, and you still can't defeat us... The Empire's generals are not as formidable as I'd heard.

speaker: Randolph
text: Quiet! Don't think you'll get away with mocking me! Attack! Make sure they never speak again!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Now!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Fire! Gyaaaaaah!

speaker: Randolph
text: Argh, a fire attack... The damage is too great. We can't fight anymore! All units, retreat! I'll take on our pursuers! Carry away the injured soldiers!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Chase them down! Leave none standing. Eliminate them before they can regroup.

speaker: Randolph
text: For my house! For justice! I will not be defeated!

speaker: Randolph
text: No... This can't end here...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Capture him.

speaker: Randolph
text: A one-eyed demon... So, it's you. You're the one who's been going around killing the Imperial troops!

speaker: Dimitri
text: What is it to you?

speaker: Randolph
text: You bastard! Life is worthless to you, isn't it?!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ha! You took the words from my mouth, general!

speaker: Caspar
text: You must be Randolph... My uncle.

speaker: Randolph
text: Caspar?! Yes, indeed... So, I see you have chosen to oppose the Empire. If so, be warned that I won't hesitate. I'll strike you down, even if we're of the same house!

speaker: Caspar
text: You took the words right outta my mouth! Graaagh!

speaker: Gilbert
text: A terrible battle, yet Garreg Mach still stands. Your Highness?

speaker: Randolph
text: I have family waiting for me... Please. I can't die here...

speaker: Dimitri
text: A beast of your depravity, prattling on about family? How amusing.

speaker: Randolph
text: As though you could understand...such a thing as love... You heartless monster!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You are a monster too, General. You have just yet to realize it. A monster who thinks he's a man...despicable. As a general, you must have killed countless souls without a shred of mercy. Do you still remember the sound of them begging, just as you're begging now? Or, now that your life is at its end, will you hold to the lie that your hands are not stained red with blood?

speaker: Randolph
text: This...this is war. I did what I had to for the Empire...for the people...for my family!

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, you are piling up corpses for the people and for your family. And I am doing the same for the salvation of the dead... After all is said and done, we are both murderers. Both stained. Both monsters.

speaker: Randolph
text: You're wrong!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Am I? I can smell the rotting flesh upon your hands even now, General.

speaker: Randolph
text: Enough! That's enough!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I won't kill you right away, my fellow monster. Unless you object to watching your friends die. One...by...one. If so, I will do you the service of removing your eyes first so that–

speaker: Randolph
text: Gaaah! Fleche... Please, forgive me...

speaker: Dimitri
text: ... What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Byleth
text: I couldn't bear to watch.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hah...hahahaha! A grievous error, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: I miss the Dimitri I once knew.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Dimitri you once knew is dead. All that remains is the repulsive, blood-stained monster you see before you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If you do not approve of what I have become, then kill me. If you insist that you cannot...then I will continue to use you and your friends until the flesh falls from your bones.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We managed to repel the Imperial army, but we remain divided on our next course of action. I anticipate a second and third wave of attack... With our current forces, we'll have our hands full just defending.

speaker: Sylvain
text: It's a miracle we managed to repel the Imperial army with the few units and resources we do have.

speaker: Annette
text: We should probably contact Rodrigue right away to request backup.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Rodrigue is in a difficult position, as he has suffered invasions by the Dukedom. But there are troops who share in our cause gathering the heart of Fraldarius territory. If we can arrange for them to join us, our forces will grow considerably.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Fraldarius... So, Rodrigue is still alive, is he?

speaker: Byleth
text: We met five years ago.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So you did.

speaker: Byleth
text: That name sounds familiar.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You met Rodrigue when he visited the monastery during Miklan's rebellion.

speaker: Felix
text: I wonder what my old man will say when he sees you now. That spectacle alone will be worth the trip.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hmph.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I've already sent word with our fastest messenger informing Rodrigue that His Highness is alive. But we'd do well to send another in case anything happens to the first. With the current state of things, we'll be completely helpless without his support. Your Highness, may I ask what your next plan of attack is? Should we dispatch our troops to the Kingdom capital or to the Imperial capital?

speaker: Dimitri
text: We will take the Imperial capital. There, I will kill her. We end the war and chase away the lingering regrets of the dead. Nothing could be more to the point.

speaker: Annette
text: Uh, that may be true, but don't forget that your people need our help right now...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Your Highness... I hate them too. But the citizens of Fhirdiad have long awaited your return.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Just give it up already. Wasting time thinking about stuff like that will only dull your blade.

speaker: Ashe
text: Defeating Edelgard would put an end to the war. That would benefit the Kingdom as well...

speaker: Mercedes
text: We still need to look for Lady Rhea, so I agree that we should get to Enbarr as fast as possible.

speaker: Seteth
text: Professor... Whatever you decide, we shall follow.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's take back Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You were entrusted with leading the church. One would think the logical step is to march to Enbarr. If Lady Rhea is being held prisoner in the Empire, we don't have time to waste taking back Fhirdiad. Can you deny it?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's take down Enbarr, the Imperial Capital.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... It is the only way.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Either way, we are in need of numbers. It is essential that we secure backup.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We have received a request for aid from the Alliance. They are being invaded by the Empire. We have only just taken back Fhirdiad, and yet I am already asking all of you to move out once more. Please accept my apologies for that.

speaker: Ingrid
text: That's no problem at all. More importantly, how is the Alliance faring?

speaker: Dimitri
text: House Riegan has rallied the Alliance Lords. They are facing the enemy with all the strength they can muster. But we do not know how far that will get them. It seems the enemy's relentless attacks have forced them into a tough situation. Their defeat at Gronder severely weakened the Alliance. I imagine the Empire now intends to destroy them before they can recover.

speaker: Gilbert
text: To think they'd watch us chase their soldiers out of the kingdom capital, then immediately go invade the Alliance... Their general is Lord Volkhard von Arundel. He serves as regent to the Emperor. He has presumably taken command after the Emperor was wounded in Gronder.

speaker: Dimitri
text: He is known for his shrewdness and excels not only in domestic affairs, but tactics as well. He is not an opponent we should take lightly. Lord Arundel...

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you concerned?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I always suspected that Lord Arundel was behind the tragedy nine years ago. The timing of his departure from the kingdom, the fact that he abruptly stopped making donations... Too many factors made him suspect. If Lord Arundel conspired with Cornelia... then what Kronya and the others said five years ago...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Hmm...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Well, nevermind that for now. The Alliance needs our help. What are your thoughts?

speaker: Gilbert
text: If we turn our back on the Alliance and then Derdriu falls, it will undoubtedly make our situation difficult further down the road. We would have enemies in two directions... in the Alliance to the northeast and in the Empire to the south.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That is true. In that scenario, we would not be able to safely march our soldiers to Enbarr.

speaker: Flayn
text: I'm terribly worried about Lady Rhea... but I believe we must save the Alliance first.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh! Maybe if we do this, the Alliance will help us out in return! We could ask them to help us attack the Empire. You know, a sneak attack or something!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Annie! When did you become so devious?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Heh. What would your mother think.

speaker: Annette
text: What? It wasn't that devious!

speaker: Gilbert
text: What do you think, professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's march for Derdriu.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, I agree.

speaker: Byleth
text: I support whatever Dimitri decides.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We must go to Derdriu.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will admit that there is something to be gained for us as well, for when we eventually march south... But far more importantly... they need us. We cannot turn our backs on them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We will arrange to head out at once. Prepare yourselves, everyone.

speaker: Dimitri
text: it was over 20 years ago... There was an illness raging across Fhirdiad. While people were dying left and right...it was Cornelia who saved the Kingdom from that dreadful illness.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't imagine it...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Neither can I. By the time I was old enough to understand, that time had already passed.

speaker: Byleth
text: Cornelia was a doctor?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No, I her she was originally an Imperial scholar. She was in the Kingdom by my father's invitation.

speaker: Dimitri
text: People praised Cornelia as a saint for ending the epidemic. But there came a day when she completely changed. Her behavior, mannerisms, likes, dislikes...everything. Despite all that, Father still appointed her to a high post. After all, she had saved the Kingdom from ruin by that disease... But above all, my stepmother trusted her. That's why what that woman said is... Never mind.

speaker: Dedue
text: Lord Rodrigue Fraldarius has passed on. Margrave Gautier has assumed his position, and is now gathering the lords of the eastern territories. House Gautier is equal in prestige to House Fraldarius. Sylvain is a Gautier. These lords are reorganizing the Faerghus army, and eradicating any remaining factions that claim allegiance to the Empire. Of course, His Highness is being kept appraised with regular reports. But it falls to me to monitor him, and ensure he does not try to take on too much. I would ask you to do the same. If you take your eyes off that man, even for a moment, he is liable to do something rash.

speaker: Ashe
text: The very same night we liberated the capital, a messenger arrived from Derdriu. Claude must have predicted that we'd retake it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Definitely.

speaker: Byleth
text: Could have been a coincidence.

speaker: Ashe
text: No, I don't think so. It takes too long to travel to Fhirdiad from Derdriu for it to be chance.

speaker: Ashe
text: Claude's a hard person to read. It's obvious not much escapes his eye though. Kind of unsettling, honestly.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital... I've heard it's a magnificent city, you know. If we're going, I wish it wasn't to wage war. It'd be more fun to visit with a cute girl on my arm.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe once the war is over...

speaker: Sylvain
text: You're right. That's something to look forward to.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah? Maybe you and me? That'd be a good reason to survive the war. Heh heh...

speaker: Byleth
text: Forget it.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Aw, come on. let a guy dream.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I went to visit my adoptive father at his home in the capital. He used to grovel at Cornelia's feet when the city was under her control. But after it was liberated, he started courting the Kingdom instead.

speaker: Byleth
text: Whatever it takes to get ahead.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I suppose he was just doing what he needed to survive...

speaker: Byleth
text: That's despicable.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Absolutely. He's hopeless. I suppose when you're a merchant, that's all you know.

speaker: Mercedes
text: No matter what becomes of the world, it'll always be plagued by people like him.

speaker: Annette
text: Derdriu, huh? I've always wanted to go there. In Faerghus, most of the towns are pretty much glorified fortresses. So to hear about a place called the Aquatic capital... it just sounds so elegant! When the war's over, I hope I can visit with everyone there!

speaker: Ingrid
text: So, House Riegan has regained its influence in the Alliance and is gathering forces. Claude always was somewhat inscrutable. It's strange somehow to hear talk of his brilliance as the leader of the Alliance.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I have been wondering something... If I had not been your student, where would I be right now? Who would I be? Do you ever think about that sort of thing, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Like what if I had led a different class?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to back and try a different path.

speaker: Byleth
text: Like what if I had allied with the Empire?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to back and try a different path.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I see... You are so focused and coolheaded. I wish I could be more like you.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Traveling to the Empire, to the Kingdom, and then off to Alliance territory... Everyone certainly is busy. Perhaps it's not a bad thing now that I think about it.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's all in the pursuit of peace.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Peace will be lovely. Peace will, one assumes, be considerably less perilous.

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, very busy.

speaker: Linhardt
text: If only we were only busy, then I think I would be fine. I'd be able to take a nap for one. But If I napped now, I suspect that I soon enough I'd find myself busy dying...

speaker: Caspar
text: Didn't they used to call Claude the Master Tactician? I want a nickname too! Maybe I'll get one if I can rescue him at Derdriu... I'll come up with a plan that's even better than his and earn a nickname for sure!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Claude... Claude... Which one was he again? Oh! Right. Yeah, of course I remember him. It's just... I can't picture his face. Don't remember what he looks like. I'm not sure if I ever knew.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Dimitri is going to Claude's aid. How great is that? It's like we've gone back to how things were five years ago. It's so nice. Just imagine if Edie was there too? I suppose you can't ever really go back to the way things were in the past...

speaker: Petra
text: I am being told you can see the sea from Derdriu. Not just see...that it is right there in front of you. In Brigid, the sea has great closeness. I would be looking at it every day. But in Garreg Mach, we cannot look at the sea. So I am feeling...drawn to Derdriu.

speaker: Byleth
text: The ocean is frightening.

speaker: Petra
text: That is true. The ghosts of the sea have vengeance in their hearts. If they are wanting to take you, you cannot be saved.

speaker: Byleth
text: The sea is beautiful.

speaker: Petra
text: Yes, I think the sea has much beauty. But can also be frightening.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It seems Dimitri has become downright charitable. But I believe he is operating under a serious misapprehension. It may appear as if Claude is appealing to Dimitri for aid, but that is not what is happening here.

speaker: Byleth
text: Another one of Claude's tricks?

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's not it either. I see it got by you as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did he not actually ask for help?

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's not it either. I see it got by you as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there another interpretation?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Yes. A fine example of how snap decisions based on mere appearances can lead to gross misunderstandings.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Claude has asked for reinforcements from here because he knows I am here. Simply put, he is not throwing himself on Dimitri's mercy. He is throwing himself on mine. I suppose there is nothing else for it, is there? We cannot turn our backs on those in need. Let us grant him the aid he requires.

speaker: Raphael
text: We're going to go help Claude? I haven't seen him in forever. Wonder how he's been... I chose this side because I believe in you, Professor. But it's not like I got anything against Claude.

speaker: Byleth
text: What was he like?

speaker: Raphael
text: Hmm... Well, he loved parties, and he was full of some pretty good jokes!

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you close?

speaker: Raphael
text: Of course! Claude was the kinda person who would be instantly friends with anyone.

speaker: Raphael
text: I got no clue what'll happen to the Alliance, but I sure hope Claude doesn't die...

speaker: Ignatz
text: So, war finally comes to the Alliance territories. I don't mean that there's never been fighting on Alliance soil, of course. There have been countless skirmishes between neighboring lords, as well as conflicts with Almyra. But this is an invasion by an army of the Empire. It's a whole different animal. I don't want to see my family get dragged into this... I hope we can drive back the Empire.

speaker: Lysithea
text: The pro-Imperialist lords who've let the Empire in have their hands tied. Houses Ordelia and Gloucester are exposed and likely caught off guard. That must mean that Claude's allies are...

speaker: Byleth
text: Duke Goneril.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Geographically, it would be hard for him to commit his forces, and logically, it wouldn't make sense for him to offer support.

speaker: Byleth
text: Margrave Edmund.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Margrave Edmund does not commit troops as easily as he commits funds, so that's doubtful.

speaker: Byleth
text: Count Daphnel.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Without a doubt she is providing reinforcements. She has always supported Claude.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Whatever the situation, Claude's military strength is lacking, and what's more, they suffered casualties at Gronder Field. I don't know how long the Alliance forces will be able to hold out against the Empire. We've got to move quickly or we may be too late.

speaker: Marianne
text: I'm glad Dimitri and Claude don't have to fight one another... I am the daughter of an Alliance lord though, so I suppose that goes without saying. Having to fight with your former classmates is just so terribly sad...

speaker: Hilda
text: We took Fhirdiad back, but I never found the time to go shopping there! When the war's over and the city is revitalized, I'd like to visit again. Will you come with me, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: All right.

speaker: Hilda
text: Really? Oh, I'm so glad! Although I suppose we have bigger things on our plate, like...

speaker: Byleth
text: Shouldn't we be more worried about...

speaker: Hilda
text: Claude! He's in big trouble. I bet my family is too. We have to help them, Professor! I know we can't lose with you on our side!

speaker: Leonie
text: Guess this doesn't end with liberating the Kingdom capital. Derdriu is next. That prince really works his people hard, doesn't he? Or should I be calling him a king now? Whatever the title is, he'll always be Dimitri to me.

speaker: Seteth
text: I thought there was a chance that Cornelia had captured Lady Rhea, but it seems that is not the case. Our next foe, Lord Arundel, was once a pious adherent to the Seiros creed. His contributions to the church stopped quite abruptly some time ago. I think it is likely the man knows something.

speaker: Flayn
text: You plan to aid Claude, do you not? I think that is absolutely marvelous. Being opposing forces at the battle of Gronder was ill fated. It hurts to side against him. I am happy that things have taken a brighter turn now.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Cornelia Arnim... That's a familiar name, yes. She once studied in the Empire. My understanding is, shortly after I left the Empire, she did as well. Unlike myself, Cornelia traveled to the Kingdom. Apparently she halted a plague, and was rewarded with a quite powerful appointment. That such a an outstanding researcher should fall to such depravity... Sickening, Professor. And quite sad.

speaker: Manuela
text: Remember the Death Knight who stabbed me five years ago? Of course you do. How could you forget? Well, it turns out he's a general in the Imperial army, claiming victory on dozens of battlefields. But it looks like he's not at Derdriu. Like every man in my life, he's run away from me... And he better run! One day, I'm gonna find that guy and pay him back for what he did to me!

speaker: Gilbert
text: With the capital recaptured. I desire to call him Your Majesty rather than Your Highness. He would refuse my desire, rightfully pointing out that he has not, as yet, been crowned. However, the day this war has ended, and the church has placed the crown upon his head... Then, he will truly be our king, and I will call him Your Majesty at last. I must go hear the reports from our spies. There is something worrying me and—No. I can wait. I shall tell you more when our information is more concrete.

speaker: Alois
text: I was getting excited for our big Empire showdown! I spent so much time mentally preparing. Then we shifted focus to Derdriu. I hadn't been expecting that. But, as a knight who's sworn to serve the goddess, I cannot turn a blind ear to those who seek my aid.

speaker: Catherine
text: We're still searching for Lady Rhea. No news on that, I'm afraid. Lord Arundel, the emperor's uncle, is the regent of the Empire. If we crush them at Derdriu, maybe we'll capture him and wring some clues out of him.

speaker: Shamir
text: Claude, eh? He always was sharp among his peers. Never let himself get caught up in conventions. He wasn't typical in Fódlan. I'd like to save him if we can.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll make it in time.

speaker: Shamir
text: I know. And I'm sure he's already calculated exactly when that will be.

speaker: Byleth
text: He's too determined to die.

speaker: Shamir
text: Heh. You may be right.

speaker: Cyril
text: Ugh, even if we do enter Alliance territory, we're not gonna find Lady Rhea there. I wish we could leave Claude be and go attack the Empire. I suppose if we can't beat the Empire forces here, then we can't get into the Empire lands, can we? I guess that means it's just hard work time, huh, Professor?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Derdriu is known as the Aquatic capital... It's a beautiful town with streets that seem to float on the water and an impressive harbor. In times of peace, it would be a wonderful place for a holiday... Anyway! Best of luck in the next battle!

speaker: Alliance Soldier 1
text: The citizens of Derdriu have all been evacuated and are now at sea! Are you sure about this? If Derdriu were to fall, those ships don't have enough resources for --

speaker: Claude
text: Derdriu won't fall. Have some faith in me, will you?

speaker: Alliance Soldier 1
text: Oh! Yes, sir!

speaker: Alliance Soldier 2
text: Our line of defense has been broken! The Imperial army will be here any moment!

speaker: Claude
text: Understood. You two join up with the troops in the city.

speaker: Alliance Soldier 2
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Claude
text: Judith, are you ready?

speaker: Judith
text: As ready as I'll ever be. It's been years since I last battled in the city streets.

speaker: Claude
text: Don't go messing up because your vision has weakened with age. Take the defensive for now.

speaker: Judith
text: Yeah, yeah, I get it. You hang in there, too, boy. Your wounds from Gronder Field haven't fully healed yet, have they?

speaker: Claude
text: No, but it's not like I can sit this one out. I have to make my daring escape, after all. And for the last time, stop calling me boy! That's an official order from the leader of the Alliance.

speaker: Judith
text: Understood, Leader Man. I wonder if our little ray of hope will show up... We fought on opposite sides at Gronder, didn't we?

speaker: Claude
text: They'll come. You can count on it. If anyone can bring him back, it's Teach. Teach will talk, and he'll listen. But more than anything, I've their skill and abilities... I believe in them.

speaker: Alliance Soldier 3
text: Claude! Reinforcements are coming from the west! Their banner is that of the Kingdom...

speaker: Claude
text: What did I tell you? They're here. And just in time.

speaker: Gilbert
text: It appears the Imperial army has already marched into Derdriu and engaged the Alliance. It seems the Imperial advance has been stalled by guerrilla skirmishes. The Alliance forces are holding out, but they won't last much longer...

speaker: Ingrid
text: That must be Judith of House Daphnel who joined up with Claude's troops. To think Judith, a true hero, would find herself backed into a corner like this...

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is not so. The Alliance has only drawn the enemy so deeply into the city to allow us to attack them from behind. Brilliant.

speaker: Byleth
text: They're planning a pincer attack?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I believe so. He put his soldiers into position purely on the belief that we'd come... I can't believe Claude would risk everything on that behalf. He has placed all of his hopes on us. Let's make sure we live up to his expectations, Professor.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Here we go. Let's move!

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: The leader of the Alliance has managed to escape to the harbor, has he? Those rats resist in vain...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Your Excellency! There's an army closing in on us from outside. The banners...are those of House Blaiddyd.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Blaiddyd? I see... That idiot failed, it seems. Hurry up and kill the leader of the Alliance. With him gone, Derdriu will fall.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will not let Claude die... Let's hurry to his rescue.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, you're late! Hurry up and help!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Look. The Imperial army's supply corps. Attacking them now would be a fine plan.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: The subjugation of Derdriu is complete. We will be joining the main army now!

speaker: Claude
text: Ugh... They're showing up one after another... Nothing for it but to blockade the gate leading to the town. I don't want the enemy's numbers to increase any more.

speaker: Hilda
text: Claude's nuts. Asking me to protect the bridge! That's so much responsibility. But the guy's so helpless, I feel sorry for him. So, I'll do what I can to protect him.

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor! It's been too long. I was hoping you'd show up. Seeing you puts a spring in my step! Come on, time to 'em the Hilda treatment!

speaker: Hilda
text: It's been fun, Claude... Sorry to go so soon...

speaker: Claude
text: Hilda! Why didn't you retreat?! I counted on you retreating...

speaker: Judith
text: It's no good...we're surrounded. But I need to hurry up and rescue the boy... To get to the harbor, first we have to get rid of the enemy mercenaries. There's no other way.

speaker: Judith
text: Thank you. That was a big help. I'll go and cover our leader!

speaker: Judith
text: I guess my vision really is going! I slipped up... Don't you get yourself killed out there, boy.

speaker: Claude
text: Judith! Stop calling me boy! I'm your leader... And I told you not to die...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Now! Hidden soldiers, attack!

speaker: Claude
text: I missed that face! And you're just in time. Thanks for that.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're OK... Can you still fight, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: You barely snatch me from the jaws of death, and now you're recruiting me! You sure know how to inspire loyalty, Your Majesty. Sadly, I'm not free to move here, for many reasons. You'll have to repel the Empire without me...

speaker: Claude
text: Professor, if you had chosen me instead of Dimitri... No. I shouldn't dwell on it. I'm grateful you came. I'm glad to have your strength, if only for today.

speaker: Claude
text: My plan failed... Teach. Dimitri. That's enough. Time to retreat. I've crossed one too many bridges... It's a shame, but... It's over now...

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Clever. I can't believe they pushed through to here. Nothing is more foolish than dying in vain. Let's get to the harbor and finish off the leader of the Alliance!

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Nothing bites so hard as a cornered rat, eh?

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: You would raise a weapon against your uncle? You've grown into a savage of a man, just like your father.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You are rather calm for one in your position. Or did you forget that this is a battlefield? Perhaps this is no time for words, Uncle. There will be time for that after we have settled things here.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Uncle, I need to know. The incident nine years ago ... You were involved, weren't you? You know something. What did Cornelia... No. What did my stepmother do?!

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: You are not qualified to look into the darkness... You and Edelgard... Do your best to kill each other... You are family, after all. There it is... the light...

speaker: Dimitri
text: He's dead. There goes our chance to gain more information. Then again, even if we had managed to capture him alive, judging by the way he was acting...

speaker: Byleth
text: For now, let's rejoice in our victory.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can think about that later.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach is absolutely right. We should take this rare opportunity to let off some tension.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's been a long time, Claude. I am glad to see that you're safe.

speaker: Claude
text: Same. I haven't seen you since the nightmare that was Gronder. You really did come to help us... You must be a bunch of soft-hearted suckers, eh?

speaker: Dimitri
text: If you really felt that way, you would not have set up a defensive battle in the hopes that we would come. It worked out, only because we made it in time... Were you really so confident that we would answer the call?

speaker: Claude
text: Of course. I knew you wouldn't hesitate to put yourself second and come running to our aid.

speaker: Byleth
text: You know him well.

speaker: Byleth
text: How insightful.

speaker: Claude
text: You and I are cut from different cloth. I wouldn't make a move unless I could gain something from it. You've always been just the opposite. And of course, I've always been fond of taking dangerous risks. After all, I sent that express messenger before you had even recaptured the kingdom capital. If all went to plan, I knew you'd recapture it soon, and then respond to our request for aid. It was riskier than usual, I'll give you that. But it was the only card I had to play, so I took the gamble.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You cross too many dangerous bridges for my liking.

speaker: Claude
text: I know, I know. But... that ends today.

speaker: Dimitri
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Claude
text: Here, take this. Use it however you see fit.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The legendary bow, Failnaught... Isn't this the hero's relic of house Riegan? Hold, Claude. This must be one of your jokes. You cannot truly intend to part with this...

speaker: Claude
text: It's not a joke. As of today, the Leicester alliance is no more.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Just what are you planning, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: If you're going to lead Fódlan, then the alliance Lords will follow you. Back in the day, the Alliance split off from the kingdom. I'm just putting us back together again. Oh, and I've already gained the support of the other Lords at the roundtable conference, so you can stop looking at me like I'm crazy. All that's left for me is to officially step down as the leader of the Alliance.

speaker: Byleth
text: What will you do now?

speaker: Byleth
text: Will you join our army?

speaker: Claude
text: Hold your horses there, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm leaving Fódlan. There are things I have to do. Dreams I need to see to fruition. That's why I became the Alliance leader to begin with, actually. But it left me no time for what I was really after. You'd better not take on too many responsibilities yourselves, or else you'll end up in the same boat. And remember... both the living and the dead cling to us without any regard for our own lives. It's up to us to break free of that weight and follow the path that we believe in.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Claude...

speaker: Claude
text: Oops! I almost forgot the most important thing. If you're looking for Rhea, apparently she's being held captive in the imperial capital. It doesn't sound like they intend to kill her, but there's no telling what they're planning.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You have my gratitude, Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: Gratitude? Thanks but no thanks. As far as I'm concerned, we're even now. I don't know how many years will pass until then, but let's promise to meet again. And when we do... don't be too hard on me, your Kingliness.

speaker: Felix
text: Well, Dimitri? Are you finally going to tell us the damned truth?

speaker: Dimitri
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Ashe
text: Didn't Lord Arundel say something about you and Edelgard being family?

speaker: Ingrid
text: To claim that the king and the emperor are related... Could it be?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, I suppose I never told you, though I do recall mentioning it briefly to the professor... Lord Arundel spoke the truth. My stepmother was Edelgard's birth mother. Political turmoil drove my stepmother out of the Empire. Father fell in love with her at first sight and they married. I lost my birth mother before I was old enough to remember her. My stepmother filled that role for me. But she lost her life in Duscur nine years ago, along with Father.

speaker: Felix
text: Hang on, I didn't even know she was your stepmother. Did my father know about this?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. All those who were close to my father knew, including Rodrigue. But to speak openly about it would have caused a scandal, and so she was our secret. No one in the general public knew about her. Naturally, the fact that Edelgard and I are stepsiblings was kept a secret as well.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I'm finally beginning to understand what you went through five years ago. I mean, Edelgard is the only family you have left, isn't she? To find out someone so precious to you is actually your most hated enemy... How heartbreaking.

speaker: Annette
text: But wait! You two were born and raised in two different territories, right? So you probably never met until you were both at the academy. I mean, don't get me wrong, I think the idea of fighting family is just about the worst thing ever. But hopefully the fact that she's a stepsister you never really knew helps with the pain... I don't know, it was just a thought.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am afraid that's not the case. Though it was only for a short time, Edelgard once called Fhirdiad home. It was a long time ago, but she was a cherished friend of mine.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Wait! I remember now! She was that girl, wasn't she? The one you gave a dagger to! Heh, so your little girlfriend was Edelgard.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sylvain. If you have any more foolish things to say, please hold them for later.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I do have a few more up my sleeve, but they can wait. Go on, Your Highness. This is important for us to hear.

speaker: Felix
text: She may be a hated enemy now, but the emperor is your old friend and stepsister. Can you bring yourself to kill her?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will kill her... if I must. But if there is any chance that the world she seeks to create could be a just one... Then I... I would love to see a future in which I may reach out my hand for her and have her reach back. That said, I have no intention of letting my personal feelings cloud my judgment. Too much is at stake.

speaker: Ashe
text: Your Highness... I think you should meet with the emperor and at least try to talk to her. If there's any hope of ending this war without more bloodshed, we have to try. Besides, killing your own family... I'm sorry, but it's not right.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I...I think so too. And you are right that we should at least try.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I see. So my uncle's defeat is beyond doubt?

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, Your Majesty. I have confirmed it via countless channels. I advise that we accept this as a drop of joy amid a pool of sorrow.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Pretty words, but I'm afraid we can't rest until the joy outweighs the sorrow. And for that to happen, it now seems we must confront them all at once. Dimitri, who took back Fhirdiad... Claude, who managed to protect the Alliance...And that professor, who is successfully mobilizing the Knights of Seiros...

speaker: Hubert
text: What will you do, Your Majesty?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Pull back our forces. In the west, to Arianrhod. In the east, to—

speaker: Hubert
text: Fort Merceus, I presume? There is no better place for such a confrontation after all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Indeed. And dispatch the Death Knight to guard it. He can buy us some time. In the meantime, I will—

speaker: Hubert
text: Forgive me, but I must speak bluntly. I do not agree with what you intend to do. Though slight, there is a chance that once done, it cannot be undone.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Even I cannot choose the direction my path leads me. There is no other way. And so, I must walk on.
